loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance and accessories for her kuliglig and to buy a new vehicle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

Lolita would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita dreams of having more hogs and hopes to have their own vehicle too. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Elme

texts.en:
Elme has been operating her own retail store for more than three years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to provide for her three children's needs. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for needs, especially for her children. The couple had to work hard with the determination of having a better income to provide their children with the better education that they themselves don't have. 

To improve sales, Elme took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, Elme hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Alma would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of fish, meat and vegetables for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to pay for more fish, meat and vegetables for her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, meat and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Solaya

texts.en:
Solaya is married with three children, two of whom are in school. Solaya works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Solaya has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her nipa roofing business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from balut vending (balut is a Filipino delicacy).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jovelina

texts.en:
Jovelina is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jovelina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Jovelina would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Damdinbazar

texts.en:
Mr. Damdinbazar is 58 years old, and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have retired from work and get a state pension. Their daughter works as a librarian at a high school. 

They live in an old house which is vulnerable to rain drops and strong winds. So, Damdinbazar is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as shingles, bricks and fiberglass for home repairs and renovations. After the renovations, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair his home.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis, a mother of three children, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For eight years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. 

Flordelis had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future, she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace. She previously accessed a loan of 30,000 PHP that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Grace hopes that she will have enough capital to maintain the sustainability in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings needed in her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly previously accessed a loan of 10,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merly dreams to expand her business and hopes that her family is always in good health. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. The Word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Sanielve

texts.en:
Sanielve is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and earns additional income from selling fish.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Sanielve has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 37 years old and is married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Leny has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish and dry goods.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Merlinda has an agricultural business, growing vegetables in the Philippines. She has been growing vegetables for twenty-three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities. She has now requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Urantugs

texts.en: Mrs. Urantugs, 40 years old, lives with her four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook at a construction company since 2013. Her eldest daughter also works as an interior decorator at a private company. Her younger two children go to kindergarten as there is no-one at home to look after them as their mother and sisters are busy working and studying. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as cement, bricks and fiberglass for house renovation. Her house has deteriorated over the years due to heavy snowfall and strong storms. After the renovation, she and her children will live in a comfortable place where they can concentrate on their study. Most importantly they will reduce their coal usage, which in turn contributes to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Gansuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Gansuren is 42 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling boots to local people since 2013. Her husband provides taxi services to local people. Their children go to high school. 

Gansuren is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy cement, bricks and steel for garage repairs. During winter, her car freezes, which make it waste lots of fuel and emit harmful pollutants into the air. In order to preserve the effective operation of her car, and out of concern for healthy air, she and her husband want to repair and insulate their garage.

loans.use: to repair and insulate her garage.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is a 31-year-old mother of three. She helps operating the family's own farm raising fish, crabs and prawns. For the last five years of growing and harvesting, she has been able to provide for the family.  

Gerlie had to be determined in her work. In order to enhance her farm, she is borrowing a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fingerlings (juvenile fish). She hopes that some day, her children will be successful in their careers, and wants to own a fishing boat for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings.

loans.name: Kartierton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe     KARTIERTON 3 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec  Adama debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 600.000 francs FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kartierton 3 group are married men who, on average, are 49 years old and have six children. They all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, one of the towns in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the micro finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities in the rainy season.

Adama, who is standing on the far left in the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to farm four hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and at markets in Sikasso to customers who are mostly resellers coming from the large towns.

Adama hopes to earn an average profit of 600,000 francs CFA per harvest. 

Earnings will allow him to pay back his loan and also help his large family with their everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano is married with one child. He operates a service based business, providing transportation in his community to make a living. His wife is a housekeeper, and also takes care of their pigs and a plot of garden. Having a family is not easy but with their determination to improve their lives, the couple never gets tired from working. 

Marciano borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs for motor repair and maintenance. He plans to improve his business by having another motorcycle to rental and provide transportation services. In the future, Marciano want to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to finance motorcycle repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Dionalyn

texts.en:
Dionalyn is 40 years old. She is married to a farmer, and they were blessed with three children. 

Dionalyn has been managing a direct selling business for the last two years, where she sells personal use products in their village. She earns a net income of PHP 2,500 a week from this business. Her net income from her business usually goes towards the school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase lotions, lingerie, cosmetics, and deodorants to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, lingerie, cosmetics, and deodorants to sell.

loans.name: Carmila

texts.en:
Carmila previously accessed a loan of 10,000 PHP that she used to purchase more varieties of fish needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to pay for more varieties of fish needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmila dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Lamdaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lamdaria works hard to support her family.

She operates a fish pond business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs. Lamdaria is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries and buy feed for her fish.

Lamdaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers' salaries and buy feed for her fish.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 59-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cresencia has a dress-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 40 years. Cresencia has requested a loan of PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials, such as fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

In the future, Cresencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials, such as fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Luís Antonio

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta 4to grado en el municipio, actualmente vive con su madre y un hermano más, su papá falleció hace ya muchos años, él esta soltero y trabaja arduamente para el sustento de su madre y hermano.

Tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de Jarcia (machete y cumas), y además se dedica a la venta de hamacas de cascarilla, ambas actividades las aprendió de sus padres pues ellos se  dedicaban a lo mismo, sale a vender los jueves y domingos, además trabaja en la siembra de los granos básicos (maíz, frijoles y maicillo)
El crédito lo necesita para comprar hamacas de cascarilla para  revenderlas, y comprará cumas ambas productos serán para  ser comercializados, y el resto lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz.

Él sueña con tener su local propio y ahí poder vender los productos , también desea construir su  casa.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old. He finished fourth grade at the town school. Currently he lives with his mother and a brother. His father died many years ago. He is single and works hard to support his mother and brother.

For twenty years, he has been dedicated to selling knives (machetes and cumas) and he is also dedicated to selling cascarilla hammocks. He learned both activities from his parents since they were dedicated to the same work. He goes out on Thursdays and Sundays to sell. Also, he works planting basic grains (maize, beans, sorghum).

He needs the loan to buy cascarilla (type of tree) hammocks to resell them and to buy cumas (long curved knife). Both products will be resold and the rest of the loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer for his maize crop.

He dreams of having his own shop where he can sell products. Also he wishes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy cascarilla (type of tree) hammocks to resell them and to buy cumas (long curved knife). Both products will be resold and the rest of the loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer for his maize crop.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Dolores requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 58 years old and widowed with nine children. 

Eulalia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Eulalia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eulalia has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Eulalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 59 years old and married with four children. Guillerma works very hard to provide for them.

Guillerma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, milk and juice to sell.

Guillerma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, milk and juice. 

Guillerma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, milk and juice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (oil, maize, beans, rice, salt, eggs, tomatoes, onion, coffee, sugar, maize flour, etc.) Also, she will buy a refrigerator to sell drinks (sodas and juices, among others).

loans.name: Kotognogontala 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame BIBATA assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  100 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 2 group are married women who, on average, are 44 years old and have three children. The mostly live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in the Kaboila commune, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 11th loan, and their previous loan have all been repaid correctly.

Bibata, seated first from the left in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan she plans to buy seeds, two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer, two drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 3/4 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and at markets in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Bibata hopes to earn an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per harvest. Earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs, and fertilizer, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is, Aurora, 54 years old with children and she is already a widow. According to her she needs to double her work to sustain the needs of her children most especially that she is now a single mother. That's why she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and seed.

In the future, Aurora hopes that she can see all her children having a good life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Kotognogontala 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame MINATA assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  140 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 3 group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have three children. The mostly live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in the Kaboila commune, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their 11th loan, and their previous loan have all been repaid correctly.

Minata, seated second from the left in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan she plans to buy seeds, four 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer, four drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm one hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and at markets in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Minata hopes to earn an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA per harvest. Earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs, and fertilizer, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Kotognogontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame CHATA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  115 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 1 group are married women who, on average, are 44 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, one of the villages in Kaboila commune, Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rain season. They are on their 11th loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Chata, who is standing first from the right of the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds, two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer, and three drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 3/4 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Chata hopes to earn an average profit of 115,000 francs CFA per harvest. Earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm inputs, and fertilizers, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Josephine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Sonia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sonia has been farming sugarcane for two years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy works hard to support her family. Judy is married and has a plastic wares business in the Philippines.

Judy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more plastic wares to sell.

Judy has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic wares to sell

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 66 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, es viuda y tiene 1 hijo y 1 Nieto que está a cargo de ella quien estudia, su hijo esta trabaja en una universidad y le ayuda económicamente para salir adelante.

Ella se dedica al cuidado de los animales de la casa como son las gallinas y cerdos los cuales los alimenta para luego venderlos cuando están gordos, de esta manera sigue adelante con su familia y hogar de los cuales obtiene ingresos para darle los estudios a su nieto, para comprar sus insumos del hogar viaja hasta la ciudad y está a una distancia de 8 kilómetros de su casa.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas como son, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas y pagar la mano de obra para la siembra del cultivo de maíz.

El objetivo de Blanca es seguir mejorando su condición de vida y poder seguir dándole los estudios a su nieto para que pueda superarse y mejorar su vivienda, y que los resultados de la siembra de los cultivos le sean productivos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 66 years old. She finished second grade. She is a widow and has one son and one grandson who is in her care and who is in school. Her son works at a university and helps her economically to get ahead.

She is dedicated to caring for animals like hens and pigs who she feeds to then sell when they are fat. In this way, she helps her family and home get ahead. She earns money from them to pay for her grandson's education. In order to buy necessities for the home, she travels to the city which is a distance of 8km from her house. 

The loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and to pay workers to plant maize crops.

Blanca's objective is to keep improving her quality of life and to be able to keep providing an education to her grandson so he can succeed and improve his life and that the results of the crop planting are productive.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and to pay workers to plant maize crops.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive con su mamá y una hermana. Comenta que le gustaría trabajar en la parte de informática y tener un ingreso para poder ayudarle a su mamá quien es la persona que la ha apoyado.
Cristhian pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus sueños.
Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Cristhian is from the city of San Lorenzo and lives with his mom and sister.  He says that he would like to work in information technology and to have an income to be able to help his mom who is the person who has supported him.

Cristhian asks for this loan to be able to invest in making his payments and in this way be able to continue fighting for his dreams.

He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving to be able to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.es:
Celeste está cursando el primer año de la carrera de Derecho, también está estudiando inglés, es una persona que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante.
Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en la profesión que está estudiando, y obtener mejores ingresos  para poder ayudar a su mamá ya que la misma es separada y prácticamente es el sostén de la  familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Celeste is in the first year of the law program, and she also is studying English.  She is a person who is exerting herself to be able to get ahead. Her future goals are to work in the profession she is studying and to get a better income in order to help her mom who is separated and is practically the sustenance for the family.

She asks for this loan to invest in making the university payments and in this way to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Yasuara De La Luz

texts.es: Yasuara es Comerciante de Productos de Pulperia, tiene 1 hija de 4 años, cuenta con ayuda económica de su compañero de vida quien es mecánico.  a pesar que tiene surtido su negocio aun le falta para dar mayor cobertura a su clientela, solicita crédito para comprar productos de pulperias y a su incrementar su inventario que dará mayor ganancia.  desea mejorar su calidad de vida y brindar lo mejor a su niña.
texts.en: Yasuara is a general store merchant. She has a 4-year-old daughter and has the economic help of her life partner who is a mechanic. Despite having stocked her business, she still lacks some products to give better coverage for her customers. She asks for the loan to purchase supplies for her general store and to increase her inventory which will give her greater income. She wishes to improve the quality of life of and offer the best to her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her general store and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy barbed wire, staples and pay for labour to mend his fences before winter.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 55-years-old widow and has four children. 

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming sugarcane for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money in order to buy a tractor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es:
Yanira vive con sus padres y un hermano, ella trabaja hace 4 años en un Banco, comenta que se inició como recepcionista, luego estuvo como jefa operativa y actualmente como Encargada Comercial. Yanira a la par que trabaja también estudia en la Universidad la carrera de contabilidad, donde está en el 5to año. Su mayor objetivo es terminar su carrera y seguir creciendo como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de la universidad, como fotocopias y materiales de estudios.
texts.en:
Yanira lives with her parents and a brother.  She has worked for 4 years in a bank and says that she began as a receptionist, then she was an operating manager and now is the head of the commercial section.  Yanira, in addition to working, also studies at the university with a major in accounting where she is in the 5th year.  Her primary objective is to finish her degree and to continue growing as a professional.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay university expenses such as photocopies and study materials.

loans.use: to pay student expenses such as making copies and study materials.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, a la par que estudia también trabaja para poder cubrir sus gastos de la universidad.
Ella es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos con su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, de manera a poder seguir estudiando y luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Tania is a student in the nursing program and, along with studying, she also works to be able to pay university expenses.

She is from the city of Ybycuí and is a very hard-working person who is fighting to be able to get ahead and help her loved ones with her work.  

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying university fees and in this way to be able to continue studying and fighting for her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, ya que quiere ser una abogada muy exitosa que ayude a las demás personas por medio de sus estudios.
Ella es una persona que se está esforzando mucho por poder cumplir su meta, ya que a la par que estudia también está trabajando.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Lourdes is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, and says that she is studying for a law degree, since she wants to be a very successful lawyer who helps other people by means of her studies.

She is a person who is putting forth great effort to be able to meet her goal since, along with studying, she also is working.

She asks for this loan to be able to cover the costs of her degree and in this way to be able to continue studying and fighting for her goal.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of a degree.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 32 years old and married with two children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like school supplies, snack foods and other groceries.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Rosalie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like school supplies, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 34-years-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she can continue to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Abogada Rosa se encuentra cursando una maestría que le permitirá acceder al doctorado en su profesión. Trabaja como Agente Fiscal hace más de diez años. 
Ella vive con sus padres y su hijo. Su meta futura es poder participar en los concursos Institucionales que le permitan acceder a un puesto como Magistrada.
Con este préstamo quiere abonar el costo total de la tutoría de tesis más los gastos de defensa, título y graduación
texts.en:
Rosa is a lawyer who is studying for a degree that will allow her to earn a doctorate in her profession. She has worked as a district attorney for more than ten years.

She lives with her parents and her child. Her future goal is to be able to participate in institutional competitions that allow people to earn a position such as a magistrate.  

With this loan, she wants to pay the total costs of the thesis tutorial and also the costs of the defense, the degree and graduation.

loans.use: to pay tutorial fees, and costs for the thesis defense and degree.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 32 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal collection products directly and selling eggs. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers for her frozen foods vending business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith works hard to support her family. Edith is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Edith has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of goods such as snack food, rice, beverages and other groceries. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Edith would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods such as snack food, rice, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a married woman with fourteen children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Luisa is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Ma. Luisa has a sewing business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her sewing business.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Lorna has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años, vive en casa propia con su Padre el Sr. Tomas, es comerciante ya que se dedica a las ventas ambulantes y también es docente.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y comenta que todo lo que hace es para poder crecer y salir adelante, como así también poder ayudar a su padre con su trabajo. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de Edredones y ropas en Gral., ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She lives in her own house with her father, Tomas. She is a merchant who works as a street vendor and also as a teacher. 

She is a very hard-working woman and says that everything she does is in order to grow and get ahead, and also to help her father with his work. 

She asks for this loan to purchase quilts and general bed linen in order to continue working and fighting to meet her objectives.

loans.use: to purchase quilts and general bed linen.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Fatima  está en su ciclo 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jorgelina, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de comestibles está saliendo adelante. Comenta que su día empieza muy temprano todos los días, ya que se levanta a preparar sus comidas que luego sale a vender por el barrio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, pollo, jamón, queso, condimentos y demás para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fatima committee is in its third loan cycle in the program of women's committees where they all work and help each other get ahead.  Every one of them is putting forth her best effort in order to grow and get ahead by means of her work.

One of the members is Jorgelina, who, through her efforts and continuous work and through food sales, is getting ahead.  She says that her day begins early every day, since she gets up to prepare the food that she later sells on foot through the neighborhood. She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of meat, chicken, ham, cheese, seasonings and other food products to be able to continue her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, ham, cheese, seasonings and other foods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su papá y sus 4 hermanos, dos de ellos están en el colegio, ella y otra hermana están cursando carreras universitarias. Su padre es vendedor de carnadas para pesca y reconoce el sacrificio suyo porque les ayuda con sus estudios y les incentiva a estudiar. Su hermano tiene una carnicería en donde ella trabaja como ayudante. Piensa terminar su carrera, poder ayudar a su familia y conseguir un empleo como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
María, 20, lives with her father and her four siblings.  Two of them are in high school; she and another sister are in the university. Her father sells bait for fishing.  She appreciates his sacrifice, because he helps them with their studies and motivates them to study. Her brother has a butcher shop where she works as a helper.

María plans to finish her program, help her family, and get a professional job. 

She's requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees so she can keep on studying and striving to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Alegria está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Mariana es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y por sobre todo sacrificada, ella comenta que se dedica al reciclaje de productos varios, como ser cartones, plásticos, aluminios y demás, que ella sale a recolectar de manera ambulante y que después vende al por mayor. Comenta que está orgullosa de su trabajo ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cartones, aluminio y plásticos, de manera a revenderlos y de esa forma tener un poco más de ganancias.
texts.en:
The group called Alegria is in its first cycle in the program of women's committees, where everyone works and helps each other get ahead. They are very hard-working and fighting women.

Mariana is one of the members of this group. She is a very hard-working woman and, above all, self-sacrificing. She says that she works in recycling various products such as cardboard, plastic, aluminum and others, that she goes out to collect them on food and later sells them in bulk. She says that she is proud of her work since it is dignified work and, above all, honest.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase cardboard, aluminum and plastic, in order to resell them and in this way have a bit more income.

loans.use: to purchase cardboard, aluminum and plastic to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria has a live-in partner and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

Maria has been in this business for seven years now.

Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 63 years old, a widowed mother of four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Salvacion has a general store business in the Philippines. Salvacion has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like noodles, beverages, snack foods and other groceries.

Salvacion has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, beverages, snack foods and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura  es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Forestal, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella vive en la casa de una tía y a la par que estudia también trabaja en la venta de  calzados deportivos y con lo que gana está cubriendo los gastos de su universidad, aunque muchas veces no le alcanza.
Comenta que su objetivo es poner en práctica sus conocimientos y poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esta manera podrá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Laura is a student in the Forestry Engineering program. She is from the city of San Lorenzo; she lives in her aunt's house, and, along with studying, she also works selling sports shoes and, with what she earns, she is paying the university fees, although sometimes she does not have enough.

She comments that her goal is to put her knowledge into practice and to be able to help her family.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying her fees, and in this way be able to continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Damas Independientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Damas Independientes forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas y conforme a eso poder seguir trabajando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luz, quien se dedica a vender frutas frescas y comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora.
Luz pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar frutas frescas para la venta, como ser bananas, manzanas, piñas, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Damas Independientes (Independent Ladies) group is part of the poverty elimination program where they are all completing the poverty elimination measurement tool in order to know each of their situations and, based on this, continue working.

One of the members is Luz, who works selling fresh fruit and comments that through her work, she helps her family, giving them all that she wasn't able to have. She is a very hard-working woman and, above all, a fighter.

Luz asks for this loan in order to be able to invest it in purchasing fresh fruits for sale, such as bananas, apples, pineapples, and others, and in this way to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving and which will be a lot of help to her.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruit for sale, such as bananas, apples, pineapple, and others.

loans.name: La Paloma Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama La Paloma, está en su primer ciclo del programa de comités, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, con la cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Rosa es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma prepara, y que luego sale a vender alrededor de su barrio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, y que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante.
Rosa pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos que necesita para hacer sus comestibles, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y otros insumos, de manera a seguir con tu trabajo, y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The La Paloma group is in their first loan cycle with the committee program.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, so they can know the situation of each group member and be able to continue improving their living conditions.  

Rosa is the president of the group.  She works selling food that she prepares and later goes out to sell near her neighborhood.  She is a hardworking woman who is making an effort to succeed.  

Rosa is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients that she needs to make food, including meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients.  This will allow her to continue with her work, fight to improve her income, and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Néstor José

texts.es:
El señor Néstor José, labora como conductor en  unas de las instituciones de la ciudad de León, se dedica a este labor desde hace dieciocho años para  el sustento de su familia, inicia sus labores a las 8:00 am y finaliza a las 5:00 pm con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

Don Néstor se acerco a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito el cual fue utilizado para compra de bloques, cemento, hierro, piedrín, entre otros materiales, los cuales le permitirán seguir la construcción de su humilde vivienda y de esa manera brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Néstor Jośe works as a driver in one of the institutions in the city of León. He has worked in this field for eighteen years to sustain his family. He begins his work at 8:00 am and ends it at 5:00 pm with the same schedule from Monday to Friday. 

Néstor approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan which was used to purchase concrete blocks, cement, iron, and gravel, among other materials, which will permit him to continue the construction of his humble house and in this way offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, cement, iron, gravel, etc…

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is 56 years old and married with three kids. He has been engaged in the farming business for ten years. He is a very hard-working person and a very loving father. He loves to devote his time to serving his family. 

Hector is requesting a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds for farming. Hector dreams to have a store for his wife, so that they can have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Michelle has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Michelle has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Michelle has been in this business for eight years. Michelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 51 years old and a widow with five children, one of whom is in school. Gilda works very hard to provide for them.

Gilda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gilda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, snack food, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Gilda would like to save enough money in order to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 27 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Mary Joy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Joy has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Joy has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cinthia Mercedes

texts.es:
Cinthia, de 24 años, siempre ha soñado con tener su propia empresa. Desde hace 3 años dejo de esperar y con el apoyo de su mamá decidió convertirse en una comerciante de gaseosas, sin dejar la universidad. Esta joven emprendedora no tiene hijos, pues primero piensa establecerse profesionalmente y hasta presentar una estabilidad económica, establecer una familia. 
Anteriormente Cinthia había solicitado un préstamo, con el cual se siente alegre y agradecida con MiCrédito-KIVA, pues lo invirtió en la compra de un exhibidor de gaseosa para mejorar su negocio. Ahora solícita otro préstamo para comprar gaseosa a gran volumen, ya que  esto le permite ahorrar más dinero, mantener su negocio con productos y ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes. Al cancelar este préstamo piensa pedir otro, pues considera que todavía está en etapa de crecimiento, por lo que necesita apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 24 years old, has always dreamed of having her own business. Three years ago, she stopped dreaming and, with the help of her mom, decided to become a soft drink merchant, without leaving the university. This enterprising young woman does not have children, since she is first planning to establish herself professionally, and when she has economic stability, to start a family.

Previously, Cinthia had asked for a loan, with which she felt happy and grateful, from MiCrédito-KIVA, and she invested it in purchasing a display case for soft drinks to improve her business. Now, she asks for another loan to purchase a large quantity of soft drinks, since this will allow her to save more money, maintain her business with products and offer a wider variety to her customers. After paying off this loan, the is thinking about asking for another, since she considers herself to still be in the growth stage, which needs economic support.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of soft drinks.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
En un corral con paredes azules, se escucha desde las 4:00am docenas de pollos que cría y vende Consuelo de 33 años. Ella, su hijo y su pareja conviven junto hace 6 años, quienes han logrado salir adelante. Ahora esto se ha convertido en más que un negocio, sino en una forma de vida para la familia de esta mujer hacendosa. 
Consuelo fue bendecida por MiCrédito-KIVA con un préstamo anterior,  para  vender productos lácteos pero con sus ganancias logro incursionar a otra nueva actividad que es la crianza y venta de aves de corral como los pollos para incrementar sus ingresos. Afortunadamente le fue bien y agradece de todo corazón con el préstamo recibido. No obstante, necesita de otro préstamo para comprar comida y materiales donde pueda darles de comer a las aves que cría. Esto le permitirá mejorar su calidad y aumentar sus ingresos. Debido a que todavía está dando pasos de bebes, sabe que al cancelar este crédito solicitará otro para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
In a poultry yard with blue walls, from 4:00 am you can hear the dozens of chickens that 33-year-old Consuelo raises and sells.

She, her son and her partner have lived together for 6 years, and have been able to make a living. Now, this has become more than a business: it is a way of life for the family of this hard-working woman.

Consuelo was favoured with a previous loan by MiCrédito-KIVA, to sell dairy products, and her income enabled her to start up  another new business venture, which is raising and selling poultry, such as chickens, to increase her income. Fortunately, things went well and she gives wholehearted thanks for the loan which she received.

However, she needs another loan to buy food and supplies so that she can feed the birds which she is rearing. This allows her to improve the quality and increase her income. Because this is still a young business, she knows that on repayment of this loan she will ask for another in order to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy food and supplies so that she can feed the birds which she is rearing

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gustavo es soltero y se dedica a la compra y distribución de bebidas por toda la zona desde hace 8 años.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por poder salir adelante e ir creciendo por medio de su trabajo. Gustavo pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas varias ya que tiene buena oferta de la misma y quiere poder aprovechar eso. Él  se define a sí mismo como una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Gustavo is single and has worked purchasing and distributing drinks throughout the entire region for the past 8 years. 

He is a very hard-working person who is fighting to be able to get ahead and grow through his work. Gustavo asks for this loan to purchase various drinks since he has a good offer for them and wants to take advantage of it. He describes himself as a very responsible and honest person in his commitments. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving and that will allow him to continue working.

loans.use: To purchase various drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Luchadoras, se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de Ciudad del este, y gracias al trabajo de todas, ya están en su 8vo  ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar.
Griselda es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas en su barrio y otras zonas, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. La señora Griselda se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, creativa y es capaz de emprender un negocio y tener éxito.  
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas de invierno, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar su clientela y también ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras group was formed when neighbors in the Ciudad del Este united. Thanks to their work, they are already in their eighth loan cycle of the women's committee program, where they are working to eliminate poverty. With three of the women below the poverty line, they must keep working and fighting to improve.

Griselda is part of this group. She makes a living selling a variety of clothing in her neighborhood and other areas. She says that she's gained very good customers. Griselda is known as an enterprising, creative and capable businesswoman who is successful.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying a variety of winter clothes so she can continue with her sales, fighting to improve her customer base and also improving her income.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que luchan por poder crecer y salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Camila, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, lo que quiere decir que está en un nivel medio de ingresos.
Camila se dedica a la venta de bebidas varias en su casa, y que poco a poco esta ganado una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos. Ella sueña con poder tener un negocio amplio en su casa, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The 17 women who make up this group are very hardworking and fight to be able to grow and succeed.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey.  One of the group members is Camila, who had a poverty level of two on the last survey, which means that she has a medium income level.  

Camila works selling a variety of beverages from her home.  Slowly she is gaining a good customer base who always purchases their products from her.  She dreams of having a larger business in her home so she can continue working and moving forward.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of beverages so that she can continue with her sales and improve her profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
La señora Norma Elena, es madre de un hijo pequeño y se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de frutas y verduras,  ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela de 6:00 am  a 4:00 pm y  realiza esta labor para la mantención de su familia.   

Doña Norma Elena solicito  a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo  para  incrementar su inventario  con productos tales como: Arroz, Frijoles, Maíz, Aceite, Azúcar, entre otros, así lograr mayor venta y obtener un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Norma Elena is the mother of a small child and has worked as a merchant for 10 years.  She currently sells fruits and vegetables. She offers her products to her customers from 6:00am until 4:00pm.  She does this work to support her family.

Norma Elena is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to increase her inventory with products such as rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, and others, so that she can make more sales and obtain a better way of life together with her child.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Arlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Arlyn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Arlyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Arlyn has taken a 5500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Arlyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and married with two children who are all in school.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Marites has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Marites aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Soila

texts.es: Maria de 64 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta y elaboración de tortillas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Maria vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para continuar con sus ventas y asi obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 64, has made a living for 10 years by making and selling tortillas. Her business is in her home and she has many customers due to her kind disposition when selling. Maria lives in her own home with her life partner and four children.

She is requesting this loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder so she can keep selling and earn more income to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto tiene 29  años de edad, es soltero y comenta que es propietario de su propio negocio, que es una despensa donde  empezó con este negocio desde el año 2012,  con un capital propio que lo gano trabajando temporalmente en Argentina.
Él comenta que también es canillita, es decir que se dedica a vender de periódicos y revistas por varios barrios de la ciudad de Caaguazú. Es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar productos varios para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y otros productos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 29 years old, single, and says that he is the owner of his own business, which is a store. He began with this business since the year 2012, with his own capital that he earned while working seasonally in Argentina.

He also says he is a newsvendor, which is to say that he sells newspapers and magazines in the various neighborhoods of the city of Caaguazú. He is a very hard-working and sacrificing person who wants to grow and get ahead.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various products for his store, such as drinks, groceries, vegetables, fruits and other products. He is thankful for this opportunity that he receives and which will help him a lot.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, groceries, vegetables, fruit, and other products.

loans.name: Hector Dionicio

texts.es: Hector de 56 años de edad se dedica desde hace  varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar en su hogar, Hector vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hector is 56 years old and has worked for many years as a farmer.  His main crops are corn and beans.  He sells his products in the surrounding area.  With the profits he earns from his sales, he is able to meet his household expenses.  Hector lives in a house he owns with his wife and their four children.

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, and herbicides, and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph.  He hopes to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, and herbicides, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Mauro Marcial

texts.es:
Mauro vive en el distrito de Parcona, tiene 18 años y para poder salir adelnate trabja como profesor de danzas y tambien como músico en una orquesta, con lo cual es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante  sobre todo porque es padre de un bebe de tan solo un año.

Mauro esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el  podrá realizar algunas mejoras en la habitación de su bebe, asimismo compra de algunos utensilios y enseres para su bebe y gastos personales; asi podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder seguir esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Mauro lives in the Parcona district.  He is 18 years old and in order to succeed, he works as a dance teacher and also as a musician in an orchestra.  This is his only source of income to get ahead, mostly because he is the father of a one year old. 

Maura is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to make some improvements to the baby's room and purchase some utensils and basic items for the baby and other personal costs.  This will improve the quality of life of his family and he will be able to continue working to make his dream of owning a house a reality.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and basic tools.

loans.name: Aminta

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar  a Aminta con su restaurante, porque con su credikiva logró comprar materias primas como arroz, aceite, cárnicos, pescado etc.  Con su credikiva fue beneficiado,  porque dio cumplimiento a dos contratos de suministro de comidas en construcciones cercanas, pues con sus inventarios aumentados cumplió a cabalidad con su clientela. Desde que obtuvo este crédito sus condiciones habitacionales mejoraron y también sus hijos pudieron continuar sus estudios. Ella dice a sus financiadores que “contar con su apoyo es importante ya que he podido alcanzar con parte de mis metas. “ 
En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para tener inventarios que le permitan suplir todas las necesidades de sus clientes actuales y en el futuro.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Aminta's restaurant, because with her Kiva loan, she was able to purchase ingredients including rice, oil, meat products, fish, and other items. She benefited from her loan because she got two contracts to supply food for nearby buildings, so with her increased inventory, she was able to supply all of her customers.  Since she received that loan, her living conditions improved and her children were able to continue attending school.  She says to her lenders that "having your support is important since I have been able to reach part of my goals."

She is currently requesting a new Kiva loan to purchase ingredients and supplies to have inventory that will allow her to meet all the needs of her current and future customers.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to make lunches.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 46 years old and married with four children who are all attending school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Chona has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
