Junieth is requesting the loan to buy a laptop computer, a tool with which she'll be able to keep informed, conduct research, and turn in classwork on time.

She's placing her trust in the loan because it will allow her to be successful.  Also, it will ensure that the good use of technology will allow her to be a more efficient person.

Junieth plans to study to be a teller, and her main goal is to finish the program and work in her area of specialization.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Hello World! Meet Jackson, a tomato farmer in Chuka area of eastern Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children. He has been doing farming for the past six years where he has some poultry, tomatoes, and vegetables. He also has a motorbike, which he uses to transport his produce to the market, and as a source of income when he offers transport services to the inhabitants in the area. He enjoys working on his farm because there are always good returns.  His biggest challenge is when there are unfavorable climatic conditions. Jackson wants to increase the poultry on his farm, so that there will be more egg production, and he needs this KIVA loan to enable him expand the poultry project. This will really increase his income base, and thus, he will be able to cater for his children’s school fees, and also to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Romeira

texts.es: Romeira, inició vendiendo sopas en los fines de semana desde hace 15 años, para apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos hoy en las edades de 13 a 31 años de edad. Sus vecinos fueron los más satisfechos y poco a poco empezaron a hacerle pedidos todos los días y hoy su negocio con ellos no se detiene, porque además ha aprovechado a su clientela para venderle también mercancía varias mediante pedidos a los cuales responde para que le paguen a crédito quincenalmente. Sus dos negocios han significado un gran apoyo a sus ingresos familiares. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es  tener recursos suficientes con los cuales aumentar el volumen de sus ventas, mejorar la imagen del negocio y con ello su calidad de vida.  Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tubería, enchapes y eternit y tejas, todo con el fin de hacer mejoras locativas que le permitan mejorar su imagen empresarial y con ello aumentar la potencialidad de sus ventas, haciendo de esta manera que su inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Romeira started selling soups on weekends 15 years ago to support her family, which comprises her partner and their three children ranging from 13 to 31 years of age. Her neighbours were her happiest customers, and gradually they began ordering soup every day. She continues filling their orders today, but has also taken advantage of her clientele to sell other merchandise through special request. She asks that her customers buy on credit and pay her every two weeks. 

Romeira's two businesses have been a huge boost to her family's income. Currently, her greatest challenge is to have enough resources to increase her sales, improve the appearance of her business, and as a result, improve her quality of life. This is precisely why she is requesting a loan from Kiva, her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will buy piping, bricks, corrugated metal, and tiles in order to carry out renovations to improve her business image. This will allow her to increase her sales potential, and ensure that the investment is a sucess.

loans.use: to buy piping, bricks, corrugated metal, and tiles.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela works hard to support her family. Daniela buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy dozens of t-shirts, shorts, pants and bags to sell. She has been in this business for six years now, and in the future, Daniela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of t-shirts, shorts, pants and bags to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Hello World! Meet Emily, a poultry farmer, living in Chuka, Kenya where she has been farming for four years. She deals mainly with poultry and vegetables, but she also has a small retail business where she sells some of her produce. She said that the most enjoyable part about farming is tendering her farm and animals, while her biggest challenge is diseases affecting both crops and livestock. Emily wants to venture into dairy farming, and this loan will help her to purchase a dairy cow, which will in the end produce for her, milk to sell. This will increase her income and help her to expand her farming enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Solidaridad Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
La socia Visitación  pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

 La socia tiene 62 años de edad tiene 07 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos y cuyes  para su negocio.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales, tienda de abarrotes, confección, venta de ropa, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, venta de pollipapapas.
texts.en:
Visitación  belongs to the SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO communal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba Province and the Cusco Department. 

The partner is 62 years old, has 7 children and is married. She raises small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens etc. 

The partner has had this business for quite some time now and it is going well for her thanks to her daily efforts. 

The partner raises these small animals to then sell them to her clients. She wants to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family. 

This loan is part of the lines of credit from the Asociación Arariwa. The  name is Credi Yapa. 

This line of credit is given to lenders who historically have good credit. This group meets these characteristics. 

The partner is requesting this loan to buy food and guinea pigs for her business. 

The partner is thankful for the loan and agrees to pay the established payments. 

The other partners are engaged in animal husbandry, grocery stores, clothing stores, selling candy, food and pollipapapas (a local food).

loans.use: to buy food and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos es soltero, tiene apenas 19 años y no tiene hijos. Marcos vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Tahari en una casa de adobe  que es de su propiedad Marcos se gana la vida como ayudante de albañil y necesita un credito para comprar herramientas de construccion que le permitan trabajar por cuenta propia, Marcos recibe ayuda de sus padres pero ellos también tienen sus gastos por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Marcos is single, is only 19 years old, and has no children. 

Marcos lives with his parents in the community of Tahari in an adobe house that is their property.

Marcos makes a living as a helper for a mason, and needs a loan to buy construction tools which will allow him to be self-employed.

Marcos receives help from his parents but they also have their expenses, which is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy construction tools, which will allow him to be self-employed.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita works hard to support her family. She is single and has an ice candy business in the Philippines. Warlita requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Warlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy .

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, who works hard to support her family, is married and has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for five years now. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing nets.

Joan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing nets

loans.name: Minela

texts.es: Minela se dedica a la fabricación de calzado desde hace 5 años, cuando en el año 2009, su esposo le suministró un capital para iniciar el negocio de fabricación de calzado, pues  observó que los familiares de Minela, tenían una microempresa de buen resultado. Hoy Minela  sus ventas   a crédito entre sus familiares, vecinos referenciados por los mismos clientes, los que finalmente  la han ayudado a que su negocio crezca. Su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación para incrementar sus ventas, que es su principal meta. En la actualidad Está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará plantillas, tacones y cuero, con lo cual le apostará al diseño de nuevos productos que muy pronto saldrán a la venta y hará de su credikiva una efectiva inversión, pues mas producción y mas inventarios se incrementarán sus ventas..
texts.en:
Minela has earned her living making footwear for five years. In 2009, her husband supplied her with capital to start the business of shoemaking, as Minela noticed that her family members, had a microenterprise with good results.

Now, Minela credits her sales to relatives and neighbors referenced by the same clients, who helped her business grow. Her main wish is to obtain financing sources to increase her sales, which is her primary goal. 

Currently, she's applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation does. With it, she will buy insoles, heels and leather, which she will apply to designing new products that will soon sell. 

This makes her Kiva loan an effective investment, as more production and larger inventory will improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy insoles, heels and leather.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 29 years old and married. She has two children, and both of her children are in school. Cherry works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from an internet café.

She has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan in order to purchase more items to sell at her store, like shampoo, snack foods, and other groceries. Cherry has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF, before this loan.

She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell at her general store

loans.name: David

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old, David from Harare. He is married with two children, one attending school.  David runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for eight years. He says the main challenge he faces is high import duty, which affects his profits. David has requested for a loan of $500 to purchase tracksuits, jackets and shoes for resale during the winter season. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase the number of orders he supplies and increase profits. In the future, David plans to grow the business to such an extent that he will be able to open a big retail shop. David is grateful for the training received from Microking and Kiva. He says he is also impressed with the quick turn around time.

loans.use: to buy tracksuits, jackets, and shoes for resale during the winter season.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 54-year-old father of four, all of whom go to school. 

UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing through increased yield; however, during the post-harvest process many are living in impoverishment until they receive payment from their buyers. 

A new loan product for UOB, the Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, is a top-up loan for farmers who have received Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for meeting their day-to-day needs during that period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
El trabajo duro y constante es una forma de alcanzar los sueños y marina puede dar fe de esto.
Ella es una mujer mu emprendedora y deseosa de salir adelante por sus propios esfuerzos.
Desea montar una miscelánea en donde pueda vender todo tipo de mercancía y variedades como ropa, accesorios, útiles escolares, entre otros. De este modo puede alcanzar una independencia económica anhelada durante toda su vida.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo mantener sus vitrinas surtidas, atrayendo clientes y realizando ventas efectivas, esto le permitirá tener unos mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Hard and constant work is one way to reach your dreams and Marina can attest to this. 

She is a very enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.

She wants to set up a corner shop where she can sell all types of merchandise such as clothes, accessories, school supplies etc. 

This way she can become economically independent for the rest of her life. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a large selection of merchandise  to keep her shop windows stocked, attracting clients and making sales. 

This will allow her to have a better income and a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes and accessories to start her corner store.

loans.name: Ana Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Ana de 23 años de edad,  es una persona con excelentes principios morales, los que la han llevado a ser una mujer muy reconocida en su lugar de residencia, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, además los fines de semana hace pan y pupusas para vender y a diario se dedica a la venta de enchiladas, yuca, frescos naturales en un puesto en la clínica,  ya que esta a 20 metros de su casa.

Ana vive y se a creció junto a sus padres quienes son  personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que también se dedican a la venta de tortillas, su familia contaba con 3 hermanos siendo ella la menor de todos a quien le correspondía ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar y en las ventas del negocio de su familia, ya que sus otros dos hermanos ya son independientes y viven lejos de sus padres,  por esa razón se le hizo difícil completar sus estudios de educación media alcanzando únicamente hasta 9º grado, trascurrió el tiempo y con ánimos de su madre comenzó a vender en la clínica que esta cerca de su casa. 

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, con una experiencia de 10 años,  actividad que aprendió de sus padres y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pan y pupusas y los demás días de semana se dedica a la venta de enchiladas, yuca, frescos naturales en un puesto en la clínica ya que esta 20 metros de su casa, realizando estas actividades lleva más de 5 años y continuara haciéndolo ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos de donde les proporciona ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una plancha para hacer pupusas,  ya que la que tienen ya se encuentra muy deteriorada y necesitan una nueva para continuar sus actividades laborales y contribuir a mejorar su casa y apoyar en la educación de una sobrina que se encuentra estudiando enfermería. 
 
Las sueños y metas que la joven tiene para un futuro son las de haber terminado de pagar el préstamo y hacer una nueva solicitud para montar una venta de comida que funcione de lunes a viernes, esto lo hará con ayuda de su madre,  ya que tiene la fé que su proyectos se realizaran, apoyar en los estudios de su sobrina hasta que finalicen;  ya que manifiesta que la quiere como si fuera su hija y todo esto lo va lograr con ayuda del préstamo y la inversión de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The young Ana, 23 years old, is a person with excellent moral principles that have elevated her to become a well-known woman in her place of residence. While dedicated to domestic tasks in her home, on weekends she makes bread and 'pupusas' [popular Salvadoran snacks] to sell, then on week days she sells enchiladas, cassava, and fruit drinks in a stall at the local medical clinic, some 20 meters from her house.

Ana lives as she grew up, very close to her parents who are very humble and hard-working persons who sell tortillas. She has 3 brothers and Ana is the youngest of the lot. It fell to her to take charge of household matters and, also, of sales in the family business, since her brothers are independent and live far from their parents. For this reason, it was difficult for her to finish her education; she reached only the 9th grade. Time passed and with her mother's spirit, she began to sell in the clinic near her house.

Ana took charge of domestic matters in the home, and now has 10 years experience. And for 5 years, she has operated her stall at the clinic. Ana will continue to do this, as it has become her principal source of income, providing for basic necessities in the home.

Money from the loan will be utilized to purchase a grill for making 'pupusas', since the one she uses now is quite deteriorated. She needs a new grill to continue her business and contribute to improving the house, and help with the education of a niece who is studying nursing.
 
The dreams and goals that Ana has for the future include to have paid off this loan and to make a new request in order to create a food business Monday through Friday. This she hopes to do with her mother's help. Ana has faith that her projects can be accomplished. Secondly, she hopes to continue helping her niece to finish her studies. Clearly, Ana loves her as if she were her own daughter. And all this she will achieve with the help of the loan and the investment of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a grill for making 'pupusas', a popular Salvadoran snack, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, and facial products for resale

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor es soltero y tiene 21 años, no tiene hijos. Victor vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Achacachi  en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus familiares Victor es ayudante de mecánica pero necesita un credito para comprar maquinaria  para comenzar su propio taller de mecanica Victor recibe ayuda de sus padres pero ellos tienen sus propios gastos, por eso Victor necesita de su ayuda
texts.en:
Victor is single and is 21 years old, with no children. He lives with his parents in the community of Achacachi in a brick and cement house that belongs to his family.

Victor is an assistant mechanic, but he needs a loan to buy machinery so that he can start his own mechanic shop. He gets help from his parents, but they have their own expenses and this is why Victor is asking for your help.

loans.use: to buy machinery to start  his own mechanic shop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia vive e concubinato y tiene dos hijos Julia vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe donde paga un alquiler Julia es comerciante y tiene que lidiar con vender sus productos a la intemperie y de noche en las ferias de la zona Julia quiere un credito para incrementar su oferta de quesos adquiridos en comunidades cercanas, el queso es usado para cocinar diversos platos típicos de Bolivia por eso Julia esta segura que puede incrementar sus ganancias, Julia recibe ayuda de su pareja pero ellos tienen muchos gastos que atender y por eso Julia necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Julia lives with her common law husband and has two children.  She lives in El Alto in a rented adobe house. Julia is a merchant and has to deal with selling her products in the open air and at night during local fairs. 

She is asking for a loan so she can increase her supply of the cheeses that she buys in nearby communities. The cheese is used for cooking in various typical Bolivian dishes and for this reason she is sure that she will be able to increase her income. She receives support from her husband, but they have many expenses and this is why Julia needs your help.

loans.use: to increase her supply of cheese  purchased from nearby communities.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice and ready-to-wear clothing.

Elena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, groceries, etcetera. She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF, before this loan.

She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing material

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao de 53 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios espirituales, que lo hacen  una persona muy respetada  en su comunidad, además él trabaja en el campo como agricultor,  los fines de semana se dedica al comercio a la venta de helados en la cancha de su comunidad; ya que los fines de semana se realizan encuentros deportivos y es donde  aprovecha para vender helados a la afición de ambos equipos.

Estanislao se creció junto a sus padres quienes fueron personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que le formaron y enseñaron a cultivar la tierra, su familia formada por sus padres y sus 3 hermanos siendo él el mayor de todos a quien le tocaba ayudar en los trabajos del campo junto a sus padres. Su nivel de estudio es de tercer grado, estudiaba por la tarde debido a que en la mañana ayudaba a sus padres en el campo, al transcurrir el tiempo, cuando ya era un joven conoció a su querida esposa, con cual se acompañó desde entonces Estanislao se dedica a la agricultura y venta de helados los fines de semana 

Estanislao se ocupa de cultivar granos básicos, con  experiencia de 25 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, ya que toda la vida ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos y la actividad que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Motivado por las ganancias que le generaba la venta de helados decidió continuar los fines de semana y los demás días de semana se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de pescado fresco. 


El dinero será utilizado para la compra de una refrigeradora en la cual guardara su producto, de esta forma podrá también vender helados los días de semana, y permitirá guardar pescado para ser puesto a la venta y también comprara bebidas refrescantes para vender.

Las proyecciones que el cliente tiene a futuro son las de tener un negocio más fuerte que le permita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  y apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sea un profesional de éxito, tener una casa con todas las comodidades  y que le garantiza una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Estanislao, 53, is a person with excellent spiritual principles which makes him a very respected person in his community. 

He works as a farmer. On the weekends he sells ice cream on the field in his community. During the weekends there are a lot of sporting events and he takes advantage to sell ice cream to fans for both teams. 

Estanislao grew up with his parents who were very humble and hard working people who raised him and taught him how to cultivate the earth. 

His family was made up of his parents and his three siblings. He was the oldest which meant he helped his parents out in the fields. 

He studied up to the third grade. He studied in the afternoons since in the mornings he helped his parents in the field. 

Time passed and when he was a young man he met his loving wife who he has been with ever since. Estanislao works in farming and selling ice cream on the weekends. 

Estanislao cultivates basic grains. He has 25 years of experience, which he learnt from his parents. This has been his main source of income for his entire life and what allows him to take care of his family on a daily basis. 

He is motivated by the profits he generates from the sale of ice cream which he does during the weekends. The rest of the week he farms and sells fresh fish. 

The money will be used to buy a refrigerator where he will keep his product. This way he will also he able to sell ice cream during the week and it will allow his to keep his fish and buy refreshing drinks to sell. 

His plans for the future are to have a stronger business which will allow him to give his clients better service. 

He also wants to provide his children with an education so that they become successful professionals. He wants to have a comfortable house and guarantee a dignified house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator where he will keep his product. This way he will also he able to sell ice cream during the week and it will allow his to keep his fish and buy refreshing drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара 50-летняя женщина, занимающаяся животноводством. Она уроженка района Шахритус. Гулсара честная, трудолюбивая женщина. Она родила и воспитывает четверых детей. Ее муж находится вдали от семьи, на заработках в России. Гулсара уже два года как начала заниматься откормом и продажей мелкорогатого скота. Она разводит у себя во дворе дома овец и козлят. Ей эта деятельность по душе, так как она любит животных. Гулсара за счет кредит собирается приобрести несколько голов овец и козлят, чтобы увеличить доходность бизнеса. Она надеется, что ей окажут финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulsara is a 50 years old woman, who works with livestock breeding. She is a native of the Shahrituz region. Gulsara is an honest and hardworking woman. She has given birth to and is raising four children. Her husband is away from his family, as a migrant worker in Russia. 

Gulsara started her business two years ago, fattening and reselling sheep and goats. She breeds sheep and goats in her yard. She likes this activity as she loves animals. Gulsara has decided to purchase some sheep and young goats with this loan, in order to increase the income from her business. She hopes that she will get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and young goats to expand her business

loans.name: Franklin Ernesto

texts.es: Franklin tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su hija de 3 años y su hijo de 4 años de edad. ÉL es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica  a la compra y venta de granos básicos y además trabaja como  ayudante de albañil desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el repello de las paredes de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la misma dado que actualmente es de tierra. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Franklin is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, his three year old daughter and four year old son.  He is a hard working man who works buying and selling basic grains and also has worked as assistant to a bricklayer for many years.  In this way he earns a living and provides for his family. 

Wanting to improve their quality of life, he is asking for this loan from FUSAI to spend on re-plastering the walls of the house and laying a cement floor since the house now has a dirt floor.   With the amount sought Franklin will buy cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls and lay a concrete floor in the home.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transportation in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from recycled materials. Sony is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her trisikad transportation.

Sony has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad transportation.

loans.name: Payka

texts.ru: Пайка деятельная женщина в возрасте 45 лет. Она замужем за строителя и у них двое детей, которым по 13 и 17 лет. Дети пока учатся в школе. Пайка в течение 22 лет занималась растениеводством. Теперь она хочет начать собствтенный торговый бизнес. Ее давно интересует торговля тканями. Она уже приобрела торговую точку на рынке своего города Вахдат. Но для купли товара у нее не хватает начального капитала. В связи с этим Пайка обратилась за кредитом, на сумму которого она планирует привезти оптом хлопчатобумажные ткани и начать торговлю. Она надеется, что ее поддержат и дадут шанс реализовать ее цель.
texts.en:
Payka is an active woman of the age of 45 years. She is married to a builder and they have two children, who are 13 and 17 years old. The children still go to school. Payka has worked with field crop cultivation for a period of 22 years. 

Currently Payka would like to start her own retail business. She has long been interested in selling fabric. She already acquired a sales point at the market in her city, Vahdat. However to she does not have enough start-up capital to purchase goods. In this connection, Payka applied for a loan, for which she plans to purchase cotton fabric wholesale and start the business. 

She hopes that you will support her and give her a chance to reach her goals.

loans.use: to purchase cotton fabric to start a retail business

loans.name: Kaja-A Group

texts.en:
Julius is a businessman who is managing a project selling secondhand and new clothes. He is in his early 50's and has three children in school and three grown. Julius has been in his business since 2001 and is able to make a good monthly profit. He sells from 8 am to 6 pm daily.

This is his 16th loan through Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy new stocks of clothes. He managed to repay back the previous loans which he used to grow his business capital (he then bought more stocks.) Julius received a profit which he used to pay school fees, home food expenses and part increases on his amount to build a house. He is so thankful for benefits from Kiva which have been observed in his family (business, education and house.) He dreams of expanding his business and finishing the building of his house. 

Julius will share this loan with his loan group "Kaja-A" which consists of seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos es una persona de 55 años de edad, que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa se preocupa por mantener su casa con la salud e higiene;  ya que lo más importante para ella son sus seres queridos. Ella vivió y se creció con su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar esta actividad, su abuela era una persona muy humilde y trabajadora y fue ella quien le enseño buenos valores espirituales, y de esta forma poniendo en práctica todo lo aprendido de su abuela ha podido salir adelante. Ella trabajo en un cafetín en el centro escolar del pueblo, y fue allí donde aprendió y adquirió experiencia en el comercio. Transcurrió el tiempo y la señora Santos formo su hogar, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y son padres de 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.  


Ella se dedica actualmente a la venta en un cafetín que está ubicado frente al parque, que es de su propiedad también se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

El dinero será utilizado en mejoramiento del suministro de agua potable de su casa, ya que cuenta con un pozo perforado y es de mucha importancia darle la atención  ponerlo bajo techo, ya que se acerca la época de lluvia y de esta forma garantizara el derecho al agua saludable a su familia.

Los planes que ella tiene para un futuro son las de ampliar y mejorar su casa donde le reforzara las bases, porque su casa ya presenta grietas, y apoyara la formación y educación de sus hijos hasta que ellos sean unos profesionales graduados. Con la ayuda de un nuevo préstamo invertirá en compra de un vehículo para hacer viajes.
texts.en:
Santos is a 55-year-old woman who works at taking care of her house and ensuring its health and hygiene because her loved ones are the most important thing to her. She lived and grew up with her grandmother who spent her entire life doing the same thing.  She was a humble and hard-working person and it was she who taught Santos good spiritual values. Santos has been able to get ahead by putting into practice all that she learned from her grandmother.

She worked at a snack stand at the village school, and that was where she learned and got experience with business. After some time Santos formed her own household. Her husband is a farmer and they are the parents of 4 children who are all studying in the neighborhood school. She currently works at a snack stand which she owns and which is located across from the park.  She also takes care of the household chores. The money will be used to improve the supply of drinking water to her house since they have a drilled well.  It is very important to put a roof over it since the rainy season is approaching and this will ensure access to healthful water for her family. 

Her future plans are to expand and  improve her house, reinforcing the foundations because they are cracking; and to support the training and education of her children until they graduate and become professionals. With a future loan she would invest in buying a vehicle to provide transportation services.

loans.use: to improve the supply of drinking water to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: grow his mobile money business to service more customers in his community who need financial services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing material.

loans.name: Erna Leigh

texts.en:
Erna Leigh is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill and pay for the laborers' salaries for her rice mill operator business.

Erna Leigh has been in this business for four years. Erna Leigh earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill and to pay for the laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Hebert

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Hebert, who is 30 years old, married with two children, ages 1 and 6 respectively. Only one child attends school. He has a flea market business in the southeastern part of Zimbabwe. He has been running this business for 10 years and sells electrical goods to the local market in Chipinge. He does not have any other source of income except from his flea market business. He says the main challenge to his business is lack of enough goods to supply to his market. Hebert requested this loan through MicroKing of $500 to purchase more stock of solars, generators and amplifiers. He says the extra income from this loan will help him increase sales and profits. In the future, he would like to buy a truck and expand his business to nearby local towns.

loans.use: to pay for more electrical goods.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru:
Нафиса жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина  в возрасте 43 лет. Она замужем. Дети ее уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Она обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сама Нафиса живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Муж Нафисы также не имеет образования и является пенсионером.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Нафиса занимается своим делом. Она швея. Шьет на заказ платья, постельное белье, матрасы и т.д. Также Нафиса имеет небольшой участок земли, где она с мужем каждый год сажают зелень, тыкву  и т.п.,  для собственного употребления. Собственный огород помогает им сэкономить семейный бюджет. Сейчас Нафиса хочет приобрести новую электронную швейную машинку, так как прежняя машинка уже плохо работает. Но сейчас у Нафисы не хватает денежных средств для покупки. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машинки. Нафиса очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nafisa is a happy and hardworking woman of the age of 43 years. She is married. Her children are already adults and independent. She turned to Arvand for the first time, because she learnt that there was a possibility to get financial support. Nafisa lives with her family in a village. She does not have higher education, as she did not have a chance to study at the university due to her family's financial difficulties. Nafisa's husband does not have an education either. He is a pensioner. 

In order to have income for food, Nafisa has her own business. She is a seamstress. She sews dresses, bedding, duvets and similar on order. In addition, Nafisa has a small plot of land, where she and her husband sows greens, pumpkins and similar every year, for their own use. Their own garden helps them to save the family budget. 

Currently, Nafisa would like to purchase an electrical sewing machine, as her previous machine does not work well. However, Nafisa does not have enough money for the purchase. Therefore she turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to purchase the sewing machine. Nafisa hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es: Micaela  es casada y tiene 5 hijos ella vive en El alto en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Micfaela es comerciante y quiere comprar refescos, azucar, mantequilla para su tienda Micaela es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Micaela is married and has five children.  She lives in El Alto in an adobe house which she owns.  Micaela is a shop keeper and wants to buy soft drinks, sugar, and butter for her store.  Micaela provides the only source of income in her home and thus needs the help.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar and butter for her store

loans.name: Belia

texts.es: Belia es soltera, tiene 27 años y no tiene hijos Belia vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Warisata en una casa de adobe que solo tiene luz y agua Belia se dedica a producir queso  y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera que sirva para incrementar su producción de queso Belia recibe ayuda de sus padres pero esto no alcanca para que ella pueda ser independiente
texts.en: Belia is single, 27 years old, and does not have children.   Belia lives with her parents in the community of Warisata in an adobe house which only has electricity and water.  Belia works at cheese making and needs a loan to buy a milk cow which will be useful in increasing her production of cheese.  Belia  has the help of her parents but this is not enough so that she can be self-supporting.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow in order to increase her production of cheese

loans.name: Shiela Rose

texts.en:
Shielam Rose is 40 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Shielam Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Shielam Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Shielam Rose has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, cooking oil, egg and other groceries. 

In the future, Shielam Rose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lusaka. He works as a coordinator and operates his own mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to many unbanked individuals. People in his community go to his outlets to send and receive money as well as pay bills. He has three children, ages 9, 4 and eight months old. 

Vincent has continued to grow his business through the help of Kiva.  He got his first loan in September of 2013. The loan helped him to expand his business and he was able to serve more customers and open up additional locations. Today, Vincent runs a total of six mobile money transfer shops. He has employed eight young women and three young men to work at his outlet locations. 

Vincent already paid back his first loan in full. He has requested for a second loan so that he can grow his business by adding more money in his six locations. This will ensure that customers are not turned away when they need to transact large amounts of money. Vincent explains that the business of mobile money is highly dependent on how much money is in the business to service customers.

Vincent would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for their support and for helping him improve his standard of living. He looks forward to more engagement with the lenders through his updates.

loans.use: to grow his business by adding more money in his six locations.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 53 years old and married with three children. Ma. Fe works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Ma. Fe has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ma. Fe aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and married with five children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gloria aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is only 26 years old.  She is from the remote village of Harimondirpara in Jalpaiguri district. She lives there with her three children (two sons and one daughter).  All are students. Laxmi and her husband Sabin both have a primary education and they could not go for higher studies due to their parents' lack of financial resources.

Laxmi's husband is a farmer by profession. He spends his time in cultivating different vegetables in his farmland, mainly potatoes. He has been working in this business for years and it has gone well for him. He is a hardworking and responsible person.  He would like to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.  Now he wants to cultivate jute, which is a very profitable crop. However, he lacks the capital.

Thus, Laxmi wants to help her husband.  She heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan from them to buy jute seeds and other necessary things to start cultivation as early as possible. She hopes it will be a lucrative business that will earn a good profit to give them a decent lifestyle.  She wants to purchase an auto-rickshaw in the future with the profit from her business to generate additional income.

Laxmi feels grateful for the loan granted and she is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of jute

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: He is 31 years old and married. His spouse adds additional income to the family. They have been blessed with three children. His monthly income is KES 45,000. He has been in the quarry business for three years, and he has asked for a loan to do mining. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another quarry site. This is his third loan with VisionFund Kenya.

loans.use: to employ more people in the quarry

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is 34 years old, married and a housewife from the district of Jalpaiguri. She attended school until the eighth grade. She is a housewife and her husband Sushen, 42 years old, works in agriculture. They have four school-going children who are in grades 8, 7 and 4.  They all live together in their own small house.  Consequently, the whole family depends on Pratima's husband's income.

Her husband works as a farmer, and he has been engaged in this job for five years.  He makes a living for the family working in the field. He has a small farmland and he cultivates mainly seasonable vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, cauliflower, carrots etc.  He is the only source of income for the family, but it is very difficult to bear all the household expenses of a six-member family with his income. So, Pratima and her husband have decided to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop.

Pratima is a tenacious woman and she is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family.  She has taken economic support from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as good quality jute seeds, fertilizers, etc. to cultivate jute. Her long term goal is to go ahead with this jute cultivation. They want to harvest the crop in abundance.

As a mother, she wishes to strengthen her children's patrimony and support them in their goals, studies and the other necessities, so they may be successful and get ahead. She hopes her business profit will help her to fulfill her dreams.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Budhabala

texts.en:
Budhabala lives with her husband and two daughters in Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district.  She is 48 years old and has a primary education.  She could not go for higher studies due to financial stringency.  Now, she and her husband are providing an education to their daughters who are in grade 11 and 12.  Her husband Biren is 55 years old and is engaged in cultivation of vegetables on their own plot of land.

Budhabala’s husband cannot give his family a decent lifestyle with his meager income. Budhabala is engaged in the business of supplying cow milk to her neighbors.  She started her business five years back, when her husband fell ill and there was no other earning member in the family.  She is diligent, enthusiastic and thanks to her hard work, now she has two cows in her herd.  Now she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high and she is unable to supply the growing demand of her customers.

She has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow and fodder.  She hopes this business will help her to support her children's education.  She says this loan can help her to increase her income to overcome the present financial hurdles.

Budhabala and her husband are very happy with this loan and they are grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business .

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 48 years old and married. She has three children. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. Jelita has been in this business for five years.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

She would like to save enough, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 55 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 16 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Merlyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosonara

texts.en:
Rosonara is a 29-year-old energetic and hardworking woman.  Her family consists of her husband and four children (one son and three daughters). She attended school until grade 5, and her husband, Rafikul, up to grade 8, but they could not study further because of their parents’ insufficient financial resources. But, they are providing education to their children. Three of them are students and are in grades 9, 6 and 4, and one is too young for school.

Rosonara's husband is a car driver. His earnings are hardly sufficient for the family of six members. Thus, to help her husband, Rosonara has been running a grocery shop from her house. She started with very few items, but now she sells a variety of items in her grocery shop.

She is asking for this loan to invest in her small grocery store by purchasing various items such as rice, dal, sugar, salt, oil, biscuits, bread and other supplies in order to continue with her sales and to satisfy the demand of her customers.

She hopes to earn additional profit from her business with the help of this loan, which will enable her to help her family in every respect.

In the future, she wants to expand her business and to rent a shop in the local market. She is grateful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the opportunity that she is receiving and wants to continue growing and working.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos de 50 Años de edad, es una mujer con una familia bastante numerosa de 8 hijos; pero actualmente solamente tiene a su cargo 2 pequeñas nietas las cuales dependen de ella, también su ultima hija que esta soltera le apoya con sus proyectos y ventas, comenta que ha sido difícil aveces pero nunca se ha desanimado porque siempre ha tenido puesta la confianza en Dios Padre que siempre esta con nosotros en los momentos difíciles, así que debe luchar con su hija para salir adelante, se siento feliz por que existe gente que apoya a personas luchadora que humildemente desean mejorar su calidad de vida,  gracias al apoyo que brindan. 


Ella vende desde que su madre le enseño el oficio y así fue que aprendió a elaborar toda clase de cosas tales como: Pastelitos, Enchiladas, Concerbas, Yuca Frita y otro tipo de productos que también vende en la localidad como: tamales de elote y de gallina entre otros.


El préstamo se empleara para la compra de utensilios para la elaboración de los productos que prepara tales como: Peroles, oyas, Cucharones e ingredientes para la elaboración de los mismos, pues manifiesta que aveces no hay como hacerle para la compra y con esta ayuda se logran los objetivos planteados.


Ella desea que a futuro su ultima hija continué con la tradición y de esta manera pueda apoyar a su familia cuando ella ya no pueda trabajar, tiene la idea de poner un pequeño puesto para vender tamalitos calientes en el mercado del pueblo mas cercano a su cantón.
texts.en:
Marcos is 50 years old.  She is a woman with a large family of eight children, however at the moment, she only has two young granddaughters under her care as well as her youngest daughter who is single.  Her youngest daughter helps her with her projects and sales.  She states that it has been difficult at times but she has never been discouraged because she has always had faith in God always being there with them through difficult times, therefore she must fight to get ahead with her daughter.  She feels happy because there are people who support other people who strive and humbly hope to improve their quality of life through the help they are given.  

She has been selling since her mother taught her the trade, which is his she learned to make all types of things such as pastries, enchiladas, preserves, fried yucca and other types of products that she sells in the area like corn and chicken tamales among other things.

The loan will be used to purchase tools to make the products that she prepares such as: boilers, pots, ladles, and ingredients to make said products.  She states that sometimes she does not have with what to make the purchases with, and with this help, she will be able to meet her planned goals.  She hopes that in the future her last daughter will continue with the tradition and she will be able to support her family when she is no longer able to work.  She has an idea to open a small stand to sell her hot tamales in the town market closest to her canton.

loans.use: purchase tools to make the products that she prepares such as: boilers, pots, ladles and ingredients to make said products.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Raypara in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Her family consists of her husband and two sons. Both Swapna and her husband, Anil, have secondary education. Their sons are also students; one is in college, and the other is in grade 10.

Swapna is a housewife. Her husband has a wood business. He purchases wood from the villagers. He resells it to the retail customers and different furniture shops. He established this retail business five years back and has been continuing until now. He works at the business every day from morning to night. He says that his major problem is capital, as the prices of wood are increasing day by day.

To help her husband to continue with his business, Swapna has taken a loan from BJS. She plans to utilize the loan to buy timber from the villagers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand her business and start a saw mill for them.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for their existing business.

loans.name: Lady Gaga Group

texts.en:
Arlen is the featured borrower of Lady Gaga group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. They have always been friends since they left their hometown, Philippine, to come and work in Lebanon as housekeepers in order to provide their families with the necessary educational and living needs.

Arlen is a 53-year-old single mother of three children. She works as a housekeeper to provide her children with their living needs and education. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's university fees.

Arlen's main aim is to provide her children with the best education, and she hopes to see them as presentable persons in their society.

Arlen is the lady at the center of the picture with the brown top. As for the other group members, Sarah is on the right with a white cap, and Geraldine is on the left with a green top.

loans.use: To pay for her children's university fees

loans.name: Nida Group

texts.en:
Nida Group is a group composed of five Filipino ladies wishing to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua. They work in Lebanon to provide their families a better living. They decided to join hands and establish the group because they need support with their financial expenses. 

Deveniel is the featured borrower of Nida group, she is a 32-year-old divorced mother with one child.  She has worked hard to provide him with the best education for a  bright future. Her  income isn't enough to cover their living needs; her loan will be invested for her child's school tuition fees.

Deveniel is the second lady from the left with a white blouse. The other members include Nida (second from the right with a light green shirt), Evelyn (first from the right with yellow shirt), and Sara Jane (first from the left with a white shirt).

loans.use: to pay for her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia previously obtained a 12,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase hogs and feed that she needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan. She will use it to buy additional hogs and feed that she needs for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sofia hopes that her business will grow bigger, and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 48 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

Lanie has borrowed and repaid 8 previous loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 2 years and earns additional income from a fresh fish business.

She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Edwin Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 31 años de edad es soltero tiene hijo vive los padres en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. 

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos. 

Rolando se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz,cebada, papas, trigo y habas, ademas a la crianza de chanchos,gallinas. Nesecita el credito para la compra de fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde, crianza para los animales. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. El sueño comprar terrenos para seguir trabajando en la agriculturapara el bienestrar de la familia. Le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is 31 yeaers old, single, and has a son. He lives with his parents in San Miguel, Bolivar province. He belongs to the Santiagueña cooperative located in Santiago, San Miguel region. 15 minutes from the office in San Miguels, this cooperative has 12 members that work in agriculture growing crops such as corn, beans, and potatoes, in addition they raise animals such as laying hens and pigs for meat.

Rolando farms and grows corn, barley, potatoes, wheat, and broad beans, in addition he raises pigs and chickens. He needs a loan to buy fertilizers, manure and balanced feed to fatten and raise his animals. He makes purchases in San Miguel city and sells in the San Miguel market. He has encountered challenges such as infestations and diseases in his crops.

His dream is to buy land to continue working in farming for the well-being of his family. He liks spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and balanced feed to fatten and raise his animals.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and earns additional income selling charcoal. Nelly is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Nelly has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Unidos Somos Mas Group

texts.es:
FELISA, desde muy joven inició a trabajar en su propio negocio de un comedor en Lagarto. Hoy cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es carpintero y en sus momentos libres ayuda en el comedor a su esposa.
FELISA, atiende su comedor y además cría pollos en el patio de su casa. Con estas actividades ella sirve a la población de Lagarto y a personas que transitan en la vía a Esmeraldas ya que el trayecto es largo y las cooperativas de transportes realizan sus paradas en este lugar.
Con el esfuerzo que realiza en estas actividades. FELISA cubre los gastos de salud, educación y alimentos de sus hijos y los pagos mensuales del presente crédito.
Con el crédito que FELISA solicita. Comprará más pollos y materia prima para la elaboración de platos típicos de la zona, que muchas personas buscan a diario, esta afluencia de turistas activa mucho la economía de la comunidad.
Dice pertenecer a este grupo porque todos tienen el compromiso de trabajar por su comunidad. Y han aprovechado la oportunidad que da FODEMI de brindar créditos a personas de bajos recursos que no tienen acceso a la banca tradicional por falta de documentación que requieren.
Sus deseos son de terminar de construir su casa. Continuar con el apoyo en educación de sus hijos y poder cumplir mensualmente con el pago de las letras del presente crédito.
texts.en:
From a young age, Felisa started working in her own business, a restaurant in Lagarto.  Today, she has the support of her husband who is a carpenter and in his free time helps her in the restaurant.  Felisa tends to her restaurant and also raises chickens in their yard.  Through these activities, she serves the people of Lagarto and people who travel through on their way to Esmeraldas since the road is long and the transportation companies make their stops there.  Through the effort she puts into these activities, Felisa covers the health, education and food expenses of her children as well as the monthly payments for her current loan.  

With the loan that Felisa is seeking, she will purchase more chickens and raw material to prepare traditional dishes from the region that many people seek on a daily basis.  This influx of tourists activates the community's economy. She says that she belongs to this group because everyone has the requirement to work for their community and they have taken the opportunity that FODEMI has of providing loans to people of few means who do not have access to traditional banking due to a lack of documentation.  

Her dreams are to finish building her home, continue support her children's education and to be able to make the monthly payments on her current loan.

loans.use: purchase more chickens and raw material to make traditional dishes of the region.

loans.name: Lucky Group

texts.en:
Gemma is the featured borrower of Lucky group.  She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field  partner Al Majmoua because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines.  They are in Lebanon  to work and provide for their families' needs.

Gemma is a 42-year-old widowed mother of five who works hard. She has made many sacrifices for her children's education and living needs since her husband passed away. Her loan will be used to pay for her children's  university and school tuition.  

Gemma is the lady at the far left side of the picture with the pink shirt.  The other group members include Erna (first from the right with a white shirt), Mirasol (second from the left with a black shirt), while Rhea (second from the right with orange shirt).

loans.use: to pay her children's univeristy and school fees.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoila Esperanza ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de madera, negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carros.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen de Copacabana" communal bank.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco province and state of Cusco.  

Zoila Esperanza is a member of the group.  She is 36 years old, in a domestic partnership, and has two children.  She works in her business of selling beauty products.  She sells lipstick, creams and perfumes.  She works from 8am to 7pm.  She has been in this business for many years.  Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell her beauty products.

She is seeking a loan to purchase creams, lipsticks and perfume.  The other members of the group work in businesses that sell wood, offer photocopying services, sell groceries, and sell cars.  She is thankful to those who have become part of her dream through this medium, and she is committed to complying with the established payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase creams, lipstick and perfumes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 34-year-old married man with three children  who are between the ages of 1 and 11 years old.

He has been in the business  of buying and selling blocks for his clients for seven years and earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES.  He has applied for his third loan of 35,000 KES to buy more blocks to shape for sale.

He will save the anticipated profits for future use. This is his third loan and he successfully repaid the previous loan.  He wants to expand his business and acquire wealth to leave a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: to buy more blocks.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by retailing rice and raising chickens.

Corazon is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell to customers.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 33 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Jennylyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is 62 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Medelyn has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita is 40 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Josita has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by fattening pigs.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy items to sell at her general store, like shampoo and groceries.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her general store, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Es una emprendedora y trabajadora,  madre de tres hijos, tiene 48 años de edad, actualmente vive con una de sus hijas, un nieto y su esposo. Cuenta con esta actividad gracias a su experiencia como cocinera, realizo cursos de manipulación de alimentos. Los clientes ese día la presentaron como una mujer experta en la cocina, ese es el motivo por el que ha logrado mantener su soda tantos años.
Doña Nidia es dueña de una soda que se encuentra en una buena ubicación, desde hace 10 años cuenta con esta actividad productiva, refleja que le ha ido muy bien pero necesita mejoras en las gradas, techo y servicio sanitario que exige el Ministerio de salud, según la ley. También desea aumentar su capital de trabajo.
Tiene un negocio estable, maneja una clientela constante, ya que la soda se ubica en un lugar muy transitable y visible, en su mayoría los clientes son agentes de ventas, educadores, polacos y niños.
Gracias a esta soda logra aportar a los gastos alimenticios del hogar y algunas necesidades que tenga su nieto. Esto es una fuente de empleo el cual ella formo y está muy conforme con todo lo que ha logrado. Desea continuar trabajando pero realizar las mejoras que le exigen; para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto y no tengan ningún peligro. Eligió Fundación Mujer porque brinda una atención  personalizada y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Nidia is enterprising and hard-working. She is the mother of three children, 48 years old, and lives with one of her daughters, a grandson, and her husband. She uses her experience as a cook in her business, and she took some culinary classes. Her customers today see her as an expert in the kitchen, which has motivated her to maintain her cafe for so many years.

Nidia is owner of a cafe that has a great location, and has been in business 10 years. She reflects that her business has gone very well but she needs to make improvements in the steps, roof, and bathroom according to Minister of Health regulations and the law. She also wishes to increase her working capital. She has a stable business, a steady clientele, as her business is located in a very high-traffic and visible location. The majority of her customers are salesmen, teachers, peddlers, and children.

Thanks to this cafe she has been able to pay her household expenses and some of her grandchild's expenses. This is a source of employment that she created and is thankful for how it has grown. She wishes to continue working but to make the improvements that they demand of her. Her customers will feel more at ease and won't be in any danger with the completed improvements. She selected the Fundación Mujer because it provides personalized attention and low interest rates.

loans.use: to remodel the bathroom and the steps to her cafe as well as buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lenelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Lenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income raising pigs. Lenelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase wood, bamboo, and paints to repair her fishing boat.

Lenelyn has sustained her business activities through  8 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will attain her dream which is to save enough and provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  wood, bamboo, and paint to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina a farmer who lives in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with her husband and 5 children; all attend school. 

She has loved and enjoyed farming for 10 years. Her main source of income is from raising dairy cows, farming tea, and growing vegetables. She also has a retail business to sell her produce. She says that her biggest challenge  is marketing her farm produce. 

Regina chose this KIVA loan because she wants to buy another dairy cow and increase milk production.  This will enable her to sell more liters of milk to  earn additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Una sonrisa cálida y variedad de productos para el hogar es lo que encuentras al entrar a la pequeña venta de Pilar, quien día a día se esmera en brindar atención de primera para ganar más clientela. Ella tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos, todos independientes. Inició su negocio hace trece años, poco a poco ha incrementado los productos que vende, es una mujer que con el pasar del tiempo se vuelve más dinámica y trabajadora, agradece el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y su hija.
Ella solicita su segundo crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, como arroz y frijoles; golosinas, productos lácteos y de limpieza personal, gaseosa, entre otros. Pilar está muy agradecida con el primer financiamiento ofrecido por Kiva a través de MiCrédito, asegura que ha crecido como comerciante. Espera seguir adelante y obtener más ganancias, que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida y obtener un futuro seguro y estable.
texts.en:
Upon entering Pilar's small store, one finds a warm smile and a variety of home goods.  Day to day, Pilar strives to provide first-class service to generate more customers.  She is 65 years old, married and has seven children, all of whom are independent.  She started her business three years ago, and little by little she expanded her inventory.  She is a woman who becomes more dynamic and hardworking with the passing of time.  She is grateful for the unconditional support she receives from her husband and daughter.

She is seeking her second loan to increase her capital.  She needs to purchase basic grains like rice and beans, snacks, dairy products, personal hygiene products, sodas, etc.  Pilar is very thankful for her first loan from Kiva through MiCrédito, and she assures us that she has grown as a businesswoman.  She hopes to continue ahead and generate greater earnings that will allow her to improve her living conditions and have a more secure and stable future.

loans.use: purchase basic grains such as rice and beans, snacks, dairy products, personal hygiene products, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as yuca, potatoes, sauces, chicken, condiments, oil, salt, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Productos variados, colores llamativos y atención de calidad es lo que recibes al entrar a la pequeña tienda de Patricia, quien día a día se esmera en brindar un excelente servicio para obtener más clientela. Ella tiene 31 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Hace once años inició en el negocio con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida su familia, lo primordial para ella es la salud y educación de sus hijos. Su esposo es su mano derecha y juntos han superado varios obstáculos. 
Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar ropa y zapatos tanto para mujeres como varones, también tintes, cremas, productos de belleza, entre otros. Patricia deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que incrementará sus productos y al mismo tiempo su clientela, lo que le permitirá lograr estabilidad económica. Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y establecer una tienda más grande para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
A variety of products, flashy colors, and attention to detail is what you notice upon entering Patricia's small store. Day after day, Patricia takes great pains to provide excellent service to bring in more customers. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Eleven years ago, she started this business with the goal of improving her family's quality of life. The main thing for her is her children's health and education. Her husband is a handy man and together, they have overcome a variety of obstacles.

She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital. She needs to buy clothes and shoes for women as well as men. She also needs to purchase hair dyes, lotions, beauty products, etc. Patricia is putting her trust in this loan, as she will increase her inventory at the same time as growing her clientele. This will allow her to achieve economic stability. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her dream is to improve her living conditions and open a larger store in order to continue growing.

loans.use: purchase clothes and shoes for women as well as for men and to purchase hair dye, lotions, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
