Ella es Flor Maria, una vez terminado el paso por la institución campo alto,  tiene la idea de tener un negocio utilizando todos los conceptos  prácticos y académicos  adquiridos, promocionando e instalando un spa, para así mismo crecer como persona y laboral mente hasta ser un centro de estética facial y corporal, para entrar a competir  con  calidad y eficiencia en  los grandes centros de estética  ya establecidos hasta el momento en la ciudad.  
Ella es una persona que sola se paga los gastos del estudio, pero hasta el momento le ha sido un poco complicado ya que no cuenta con suficientes recursos para poder pagar el valor de las cuotas con el precio normal de campo alto, es por eso que solicita el convenio con kiva, ya que este es el último semestre de ella y los gastos se incrementan un poco.
texts.en: Her name is Flor Maria.  Once she completes her time at the Campo Alto Institute, she plans to open a business using all of the practical and academic concepts that she has acquired.  She will promote and open a spa so that she can grow as a person and a worker until she makes it into a center for facial and body aesthetics where she can compete with the large beauty centers that are already established in the city through her quality and efficiency.  She alone pays for her education costs, but at the moment it has become a little complicated because she does not have the necessary resources to pay for the cost of her tuition given the normal cost at Campo Alto.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from Kiva since this is her last semester and the cost has increased slightly.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael, de 52 años se dedica a la producción y venta de cremas y helados con deliciosos sabores frutales.
Vende sus productos de manera ambulante por las calles del municipio de Itagüí, Antioquia cargando una nevera portátil y atendiendo amablemente varios clientes diarios. Vende sus productos al por menor y por mayor lo que hace que tenga un amplio espectro de mercado.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar la materia prima de sus productos que son principalmente frutas, de esta forma podrá tener más y mejor producción.
Actualmente genera un empleo pero su objetivo es poder generar más.
El vela por sus hijos y su esposa y son las personas responsables de su motivación y su esfuerzo día a día.
texts.en:
Rafael is 52 years old and works in the production and sale of creams and ice creams with delicious fruit flavors. He sells his products on foot in the streets of the Itagüí, Antioquia municipality carrying a portable cooler and pleasantly serving his daily customers. He sells his products individually and wholesale which brings him a wide range of business. 

He is applying for a loan to buy the raw materials for his products which are principally fruits. This way he can have increased and enhanced production. He currently employs one position but his goal is to create more. He cares for his children and his wife and they are the people responsible for his motivation and strength each day.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fruits) to continue his production of creams and ice creams.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita, 61, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married, and she has five children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Julita maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products, of popular direct-selling brands, like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer, and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those published in the catalogue, and the difference is the profit that dealer earns, as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales, every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional products for her business, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, and undergarments.

Julita hopes that her business will grow bigger and have more connections. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her business, like shampoo, fabric softener, and undergarments.

loans.name: José Atilio

texts.es: José tiene 62 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa y su hija de 24 años de edad. José  se dedica a la venta de medicina  como vitaminas. La venta la realiza desde hace 9 años de forma ambulante  y gracias a su carisma y a los  buenos precios que ofrece ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. José desea construir un cuarto para cocina por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir  en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, ladrillo, arena, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: José is 62 years old and lives in very humble conditions with his wife and 24 year old daughter. José sells medicine such as vitamins. He has been selling door-to-door for 9 years and thanks to his charisma and the good prices he offers he has been able to gain the confidence of many customers who prefer his products more every day. José wishes to build a room for a kitchen so he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy the needed materials such as cement, brick, sand, etc. He hopes to be able to count on this financing and in this way be able to proceed with building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, brick, sand, etc. to build a room for a kitchen.

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie previously accessed an 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, personal house hold, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for 19,000 PHP to buy more merchandise and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lennie dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to improve her living. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Leovigilda

texts.en:
Leovigilda previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leovigilda hopes that her business will last long and dreams to have a peaceful life. She meets weekly  with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion previously borrowed a 35,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy fertilizer and farm inputs. Her earnings greatly helped her in paying for her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Now, Adoracion is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. This loan will also be used to pay for farm expenses. Her profits will help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adoracion dreams that her business will be successful and improve her living conditions. Every week she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farming expenses

loans.name: Anamir

texts.en:
Anamir a married mother with four children who works hard to support her family.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines and earns additional income selling rice and raising livestock. Anamir is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anamir has sustained her business activities through five  previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is  a married mother of two children who works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines and earns additional income raising pigs and selling rice. Theresa is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to restock  frozen foods to sell to customers.

Theresa has sustained her business through five previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Orbelina

texts.es:
Rosa de 40 Años de edad, es una persona muy honrada todo su tiempo lo dedica a  a su trabajo de red solidaria, las personas le tienen mucho aprecio, porque ella siempre le da consejo sobre remedios caseros a sus vecinos, ella ademas tiene cocimientos sobre plantas beneficiosas para curar algunas enfermedades, su esposo quien se divorcio de ella a formado otra familia, pero ella dice que continua su vida trabajando ya que ella bajo las circunstancias de la vida sueña con que su hija sea una profesional con grandes éxitos, ademas ella tiene un pequeña granja de aves la cual también le generan ingresos.


Rosa trabaja en red solidaria y su experiencia es muy amplia con mucho entusiasmo cada día se levanta con muchos deseos de superación y con ello apoyar a otros que necesitan ayuda, personas de escasos recursos apoyados por el gobierno de la nación.


El préstamo sera utilizado en la consolidación de deuda, esto le permitirá pagar otra deuda con una institución y quedar libre de ello, ya que hace un poco tiempo le toco que arreglar su casa y se endeudo para mejorar las paredes que se estaban deteriorando.


A futuro piensa tener una granja que genere producto para toda la comunidad, esto traerá ganancias y beneficios para la comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, is a honorable person. All of her time is dedicated to her work in with a support network. People are very grateful because she always gives her neighbors advice on home remedies. She also has knowledge of plants that are useful for curing some illnesses. Her husband divorced her in order to form another family but she says that she continues her life work since she is under these circumstances in life. She dreams that her daughter will be a professional with much success. 

She also has a small bird farm which also generates income. Rosa works in a supportive network and her experience is wide. With much enthusiasm, she gets up every day with dreams of getting ahead and helping others who are in need, just like people with limited resources are helped by the national government. 

The loan will be used to consolidate debt. This will allow her to pay off a debt with an institution and be free of it. It recently came time to fix her house and she took out a loan to repair the walls which were deteriorating. 

In the future, she is thinking of having a farm that generates products for the entire community. This will bring earnings and benefits to the community.

loans.use: to consolidate debt.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rhoda requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rhoda has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

In the future, Rhoda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma es una joven de 25 años de edad, que estudio hasta bachillerato,  comenta que mejor prefirió trabajar y no seguir estudiando pero que todavía no descarta continuar sus estudios  universitarios, ella es casada madre de un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo es empleado de seguridad y también se dedica a la agricultura, en su vivienda viven junto a su madre, su esposo y su hijo.

Norma es secretaria en una institución y a la vez se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar , comenta que tiene ya 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad de secretaria y que la desempeña con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación porque gracias a ello es donde obtiene sus ingresos económicos para su familia, el trabajo lo obtuvo gracias a una amiga que la recomendó para que pudiera trabajar  en la institución, ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana y luego aborda un bus una hora para poder llegar a su lugar de trabajo, comenta que siempre recibe el apoyo de su esposo en los actividades que se realizan en su vivienda. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para la remodelación de su vivienda específicamente lo utilizara en la compra de 3,000 tejas de barro, madera y pago de mano de obra, gracias al financiamiento estará más segura con su familia y más aún que ya está la época lluviosa a ella le urge reparar su vivienda y vivir más cómodamente y segura junto a su familia.
   
Norma desea para el futuro en primer lugar seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria la que ella desea, también remodelar más su vivienda para vivir más cómodamente con su familia también en un  futuro tener un mejor empleo que le genere mejores ingresos para su familia y que su hijo estudie mucho para que sea una persona de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Norma is a 25-year-old woman who is pursuing her bachelor's degree. She says that she would rather work and not keep going to school, but she won't quit her university studies. She is married and the mother of a three-year-old son. Her husband works in security and is also a farmer. Norma lives with her mother, her husband, and her son.

Norma is a secretary at an business and at the same time, she keeps up the house. She says she has been a secretary for four years, and she works enthusiastically and with dedication, because thanks to the job, she has income for her family. She got the job thanks to a friend who recommended her so she could work at the business. Norma wakes up at 5 am and rides the bus for an hour to get to work. She says that she always has her husband's support with household chores.

She will use this loan to remodel her house. Specifically, she will use it to purchase 3000 clay tiles and wood and to pay for helping hands. Thanks to the loan, she and her family will be safer, even more so because this is the rainy season, and it's pushing her to repair her home and live more comfortably and safely with her family.

For the future, Norma wants, first and foremost, to continue studying at the university. She also wants to remodel her home to live more comfortably with her family. She also wants to have a better job that will bring in better income for her family as well as for her son to study a lot so that he can be a well-to-do person.

loans.use: purchase 3000 clay tiles and wood, and to pay for workers to remodel her home.

loans.name: Sindy Nathali

texts.es: Sindy tiene 21 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño. Ella se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Sindy se dedica a la venta de bisutería y venta de frutas en su lugar de habitación. El negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años y medio aproximadamente y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea  invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería como: piedras, nailon, tenazas, etc. para el negocio de bisutería y además, desea invertir en el negocio de frutas de tal forma que pueda mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y poder así dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Sindy is 21 years old and a single mother of one son. She is described as being enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. Sindy sells costume jewelry and fruit from her home. She has had the business for 2.5 years and it is her primary source of income. She seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in her business in buying merchandise such as stones, nylon, pliers, etc for her costume jewelry business and in addition, she wishes to invest in her fruit business in order to increase her sales and income and be able to provide better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy stones, nylon, pliers, etc. for her costume jewelry business and in addition she wishes to invest in a fruit business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
He is 38 years old,now. He has been running a private, primary school for eight years, and his monthly income is KES 50,000. He has borrowed a loan of KES 120,000, which he will use to construct another classroom. With the profits he gets, he will employ more people in the business.

This is his second loan, and he repaid the previous loan successfully. His hopes and dreams in future are to develop his primary school to include a high school, and to live a sustainable life with his family members.

loans.use: to construct another classroom.

loans.name: Francin Group

texts.en:
Marie is the featured borrower of Francin group.  She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. They have become best friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to works as housekeepers in Lebanon. They pay for their families'  education and living expenses.

Marie is a 39-year-old married mother of four who works as a housekeeper to support her family in the Philippine. Her loan will be invested to support her children and cover  their living needs and tuition fees.

Marie is the first lady from the left with a pink shirt. She is joined by Jocelyn (center with a yellow shirt). and Mrcedita (first from the right with a blue shirt).

loans.use: to support her children back in the Philippine and cover the costs of  increasing living needs and  tuition fees.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
Cecilio previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that he used to maintain his tricycle. His earnings helped him to educate his child and pay for personal, household, and business expenditures.

Now, Cecilio would like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan. The funds will also go towards buying spare parts and maintaining his tricycle. His business profits will help him sustain his family's daily needs and educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Cecilio hopes to purchase another tricycle. He strives to provide his family with a good future. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle

loans.name: Consillie

texts.en:
Consillie is 32 years old. She is married with four children. 

This is a new loan from UOB (Urwego Opportunity Bank). The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure. The loan will help to pay for the construction of a warehouse for storage for her maize harvest that is waiting to be bought by the buyers. When the sight is finished being constructed, it will help all the community members to store stock in the building. 

UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is significantly improving their yield or production. During the post-harvest process many suffer from poverty, as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role in solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a mother of 1 child who lives in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya. She is a farmer and has dairy cows, poultry, and a variety of horticultural crops in her farm. Besides farming, she has a retail business to sell her produce. Her favorite part of farming is growing her crops and raising livestock. Her biggest challenge is a lack of good markets and not enough rainfall.

Flora wants to produce more milk and  has requested a KIVA loan to purchase a dairy cow that will help increase milk production. This will ensure an increase in income to take care of her young family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 59 -years-old widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested 10,000 PHP amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Delia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 34 years old. He is married with eight children. 

This is a new loan from UOB (Urwego Opportunity Bank). The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top loan for farmers who have had received Agriculture Production financing and that are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is significantly helping their yield or production. 

During the post-harvest process many farmers suffer from poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for construction of a warehouse/store for maize.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda lives in the Philippines. She is married. For the past fifteen years, Reynalda has sold fruits and vegetables for a living. She works very hard to support her family.

Reynalda is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Reynalda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Andrea Patricia

texts.es:
Cada mañana, una vez que ha tomado su cafecito caliente para tener mucha energía, Andrea limpia y ordena su pulpería,  donde ofrece productos variados y de calidad, razón por la que día a día gana más clientela. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Hace cuatro años inició su negocio con el objetivo de apoyar en la economía familiar, puesto que hay días buenos y otros difíciles. Con el apoyo de su esposo han salido adelante. Es una mujer emprendedora, ha iniciado el negocio de la venta de fresco ambulante, para obtener más ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, especias, gaseosas, asimismo la compra de una carretilla y termos para la venta de fresco. Andrea deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que anhela brindarle a su familia salud y educación de primera, ofrecerles un futuro prospero.  Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, aspira un negocio más grande, en el que se ofrezcan productos de primera necesidad para la satisfacción del cliente.
texts.en:
Andrea is 36, married, and the mother of three children. Every morning, after having a cup of coffee to invigorate herself, she cleans and organizes her grocery store. Andrea sells a wide variety of quality products and has been steadily gaining more customers. Andrea opened the store four years ago so that she could contribute to the finances of her family, which has experienced good times, but also challenging ones. Andrea is a resourceful woman who has, with the support of her husband, managed to improve her family's situation. Andrea has started a second business selling cheese in her neighborhood to earn more income. 

Andrea is applying for a loan to make her capital more productive. She needs to purchase staple grains, dairy products, spices, soft drinks, as well as a wheelbarrow and coolers for selling cheese. Andrea is confident that a loan will benefit her businesses, and aspires to provide for her family family's health and her children's primary school education. She wants the children to have a prosperous future. One of Andrea's goals is to improve conditions in her home; another is to expand her business, which offers her customers essential goods to meet their needs.

loans.use: purchase staple grains, dairy products, spices, and soft drinks, as well as a wheelbarrow and coolers to sell cheese.

loans.name: Edgar Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso tiene 58 años de edad, el es un señor casado y tiene 5 hijos, Alfonso vive con su esposa, su suegra que ya es mayorcita,  con un hijo que ya es casado y tiene un bebe y con una hija que es madre soltera, Alfonso se dedica 35 años a la carpintería, el va a invertir el crédito en la compra de madera para la fabricación de muebles, su aspiración es seguir apoyando con techo y comida a sus hijos y nietos que más lo necesitan.
texts.en: Alfonso is 58 years old, married, and the father of five children. He lives with his wife; her elderly mother; his son, who is married with a baby; and a daughter who is a single mother. Alfonso has been a carpenter for 35 years, and will invest the funds from this loan in the purchase of wood for making furniture. Alfonso's ambition is to continue providing food and shelter for his children and especially his grandchildren, who need Alfonso's support the most.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, metals to make knives and machetes, and to feed his family.

loans.name: Adonay Efraín

texts.es:
Adonay de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato técnico comercial opción contador, está soltero y actualmente vive con su mamá, un hermano el cual aún estudia bachillerato y un tío que por su avanzada edad lo tienen en la casa de él cuidándolo ya que frecuentemente se enferma.

Adonay se dedica a trabajar como corralero desde hace tres años,  cuando salió de estudiar no puedo encontrar un trabajo de acuerdo a su estudio y con el afán de ayudarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar decidió trabajar como corralero cuidando el ganado, de un señor de la comunidad, de esta manera él ha podido apoyar a su madre en los gastos y en los estudios de su hermano menor, así como con las medicinas del  tío, en el tiempo que él estudio se dedicaba los fines de semana a cultivar la tierra sembrando maíz y frijol, y en los momentos libres se dedicaba a la elaboración de hamacas. Desde que era un niño ha trabajado ya que su madre le ha enseñado los oficios con los que ella también trabaja, su horario de trabajo inicia a las 3:00am que es cuando tiene que ordeñar el ganado ya que el patrón llega a las 5:00am a traer la leche y él tiene que tener todo listo cuando él llega, en el transcurso del día tiene que cuidar todo el ganado alimentándolo y por la tarde a las 2:00am tiene que ordeñar nuevamente,  él vive de su casa a su lugar de trabajo a 45 minutos a pie y tiene que salir de su casa a las 2:00am para estar a tiempo en su trabajo y hay veces que se queda a dormir en su trabajo para avanzar más en los quehaceres diarios, le sale muy pesado el día pero él lo hace con mucho gusto sabiendo que a su  familia no le faltara el alimento todos los días. 

Con el crédito comprara una motocicleta para trasladarse en la madrugada de su casa al trabajo y viceversa ya no será tan pesado y peligroso en el camino, ahorrara tiempo de traslado y esto le permitirá compartir unos minutos más con su familia todos los días.  Comprará la motocicleta de una sola ves de esta manera le saldrá más barata que comprándola por letras corridas.

Su principal sueño es poder mejorar la vivienda en la cual habita con su familia y poder comprar una parcela de tierra donde él pueda construir su propia casa y formar una familia, desea que su hermano se supere en sus estudios para que sea una persona de bien en la comunidad y de esta manera que él también le ayude con los gastos para que su madre ya no tenga que trabajar tanto , ya que ella se dedicó a trabajar para superarlos a ellos y  él desea hacer lo mismo por ella, para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adonay, 23 years old, went to school until the third year of a technical degree in commercial operations. He is single and lives with his mother, a brother who is studying for his bachelor's degree, and an uncle who, because he is getting on in age, stays at their house so they can take care of him because he is frequently sick.

Adonay has worked as a ranch hand for three years. When he finished school, he couldn't find a job related to his studies, and with the desire to help his mother with household expenses, he decided to work as a ranch hand, caring for the livestock of a man in the community. In this way, he has been able to help his mother with expenses and with his younger brother's schooling, as well as with his uncle's medicine. While he was in school, he spent the weekend farming the land and planting corn and beans, and in his free time, he made hammocks. Since he was young, he has worked with his mother, who taught him her trade. His work day starts at 3 am when he has to milk the cows because the boss arrives at 5 am to get the milk, and Adonay has to have everything ready when he arrives. Throughout the day, he has to take care of all the livestock, feeding them, and in the afternoon, at 2 pm, he has to milk them again. He lives 45 minutes away from work (by foot) and he has to leave his house a 2 am to get to work on time. There are times that he stays to sleep at work in order to get ahead on his daily chores. He ends the day very tired, but he does it gladly because he knows that his family won't want for food.

With this loan, he will buy a motorcycle to go from home to work in the early morning and vice versa so that he won't be so tired and sleepy on the walk. He will save time commuting, and this will allow him to spend a few more minutes with his family every day. He will buy the motorcycle in person because he'll be able to get it cheaper than mail-ordering it.

Adonay's greatest dream is to be able to improve his family's living conditions and to purchase a piece of land where he can build his own home and start a family. He wants his brother to succeed in his schooling so that he can be a person of means in the community and also help his mother with household expenses so she won't have to work so hard. She worked to help them, and he wants to do the same for her so she can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo tiene la edad de 18 años está cursando la carrera de Ing. Agrícola, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres para la mensualidad de la universidad, para actualizarse constantemente en los avances de su carrera el solicita el crédito para poder comprar una computadora, herramienta que también utilizara para realizar los tareas universitarias, sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y no pueden cubrir este bien de un solo gasto, es por eso que acude a solicitar este financiamiento.
texts.en: Eduardo is 18 years old and is studying agricultural engineering. He counts on his parents' support to pay for school. In order to stay up to date with the advancements in his field, he is requesting the loan to purchase a computer, a tool that he will also use for his university studies. His parents have limited economic ability, and they cannot cover this cost in just one payment. This is why he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Ana Mirna

texts.es: Ana tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo que es menor de edad. Ana trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 3 años y es así como junto a su compañero de vida quien trabaja como jornalero llevan el sustento a su hogar. Ana solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un corredor en su vivienda por lo que necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento y arena. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción antes que empiece el invierno.
texts.en: Ana is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son, who is a minor. Ana has worked as a domestic employee for three years, and her husband works as a day laborer to sustain the household. Ana is requesting this loan from Kiva partner FUSAI because she wants to build a hallway in her home. For this, she needs materials such as sheet metal,, wood, cement, and sand. She hopes to get this loan so she can begin construction before winter sets in.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, wood, cement, and sand to build a hallway in her house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old, married and blessed with three children ages under one year old. He has been in business transporting water and charcoal by motorbike for four years. His monthly income is 8,000 KES.

David has borrowed a loan to repair his motorbike and continue supplying water and charcoal. The anticipated profit from the improvements, will allow him to expand his business.

This is his first loan. His hopes and dreams for future are for his business to grow and to able to run his family well.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 34 years old and married. He has been in business as a carpenter for eight years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES. His spouse adds additional income to the family, which helps support the three children they are blessed with. Paul is asking for a loan so he can purchase materials for carpentry work.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 30 years old. He is the father of three children between ages seven and eleven years. 

This is a new loan product for UOB. This loan will help construct a warehouse to support the local produce business, providing a place for growers to store their harvest before it is purchased by buyers. This new infrastructure will help the entire community by ensuring secure storage of their produce. UOB’s farmers clients will benefit from the project because during the post-harvest season, they are more likely to struggle financially, as they have to wait for their buyers to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role to bridge this financial gap, helping the farmers more consistently meet their day to day needs during the period.

loans.use: to build a community

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam, age 39, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has two children, aged 3 years and 2 months. One of them attends school. Sam deals in textiles and earns additional income as a veterinary officer.

He desires to increase his stock, that is, to obtain more clothes to sell. Limited capital affect his business. He is acquiring credit, in order to restock second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to restock second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living farming vegetables in the Philippines. Letty is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional seed, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Letty has been farming vegetables for 20 years and earns additional income by providing motorcycle transportation services.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional chicken and spices for her business.

Linda has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Linda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken and spices for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaumi

texts.en:
Mwanaumi is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Mwanaumi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Mwanaumi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby; in addition, she sells potatoes. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman in her 30's. She lives with her husband and two sons in a sector in Jordan called Karak. Her husband works as a teacher. 

She has been selling dresses, accessories and cosmetics at her own shop for one year. 

She faced problems in direct, and because of the need to expand her market and to buy more merchandise, she applied for this loan to support her aim.

loans.use: To buy more accessories, dresses and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend from school. She lives at her house that has electricity and piped water.

Asha has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at the market where her clients are passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to pay school fees and with the rest, to add stock to her beauty salon business. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees and the use the rest to add stock to her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman. She has no children. Halima rents a house that has electricity but not piped water.

For the past three years, Halima has operated a business that sells clothes. She sells clothes door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. High transportation costs are a major challenge to her business. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique. 

Halima is requesting a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She joined Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a business selling drinks like juice and cold water at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a refrigerator to use in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to use in her business

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria se dedica los fines de semana a la venta de comida, su negocio está ubicado en un lugar que es muy visitado por las personas de su localidad ya que existe un parque recreativo para toda la familia, los demás días de la semana se dedica al trabajo del campo, ella es madre soltera de un hijo de 10 años que asiste a la escuela, vive en la casa de sus padres, y su aspiración es segui luchando en la vida todo para bienestar de su  hijo.
texts.en: Maria is the single mother of a ten-year-old son who attends school. She does farm labor during the week, but also has a business selling food on weekends. Maria sells the food that she prepares in a very busy location by a recreational park in her neighborhood that attracts parents and their children. Maria and her son live with their parents, and her ambition is to continue striving and dedicating everything she does to her son's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the food she prepares and sells.

loans.name: Amn Al- Yemen Group

texts.en:
This group is called Amn Al-Yemen. It consists of six women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 230,000 YER from AMB.

Amira is 33 years old; she is a married woman with five children. She lives with them in a rented house in a poor area. She works as a tailor. Her business was set up in her place of residence one year ago. 

She sews all kinds of clothes for the people in her area.  She works with only one sewing machine. With only one sewing machine, it takes Amira a long time to do a small amount of work. Also, she only has a small amount of materials for sewing and needs more. This affects her business negatively. 

She is very detail-oriented and does very well. She thinks that she works very well because she loves her work. This allows her to have the loyalty of many customers, friends, and neighbors.  

Amira is asking for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to purchase another sewing machine in addition to the one she has now, and to purchase more sewing materials, such as as fabric, thread, and other materials in order to improve her business. 

Amira looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a dressmaking store.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and more sewing materials

loans.name: Joyce Munini

texts.en:
Joyce Munini is a thirty-eight-year-old lady. She is married and has one child. She sells herbal medicine products. She has been in this business for ten years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy a stock of natural products. She plans to use the profits to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more herbal medicines

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: SEVERO es soltero y vive en El alto en una casa de adobe en la que se gana unos pesos como cuidador aunque la principal actividad de Severo es ser chofer  y necesita un credito para mantenimiento de movilidad Severo esta completamente solo y por eso depende de su ayuda
texts.en: Severo is single and lives in El Alto in a house made of adobe, where he earns a little money as a carer. His main means of earning a living is as a driver, and he needs a loan in order to maintain his mobility. Severo is completely alone and so he is depending on this support.

loans.use: to maintain his mobility.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
He is 38 years old. His spouse earns income, in addition to his income. He has five dependents; three of them are his children. He has been in business for seven years. His monthly income is KES 10,000.

He has borrowed a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the anticipated profits he gets, he will expand the farming business. His hopes and dreams in future are to expand his farming and family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Abiya

texts.en:
Abiya is 40 years. She is from Madrasapara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a housewife. Her husband Amirul, 62 years old, is a farmer by profession.  Both are illiterate and can sign only their names. They have only one son. He is grown up and engaged in a poultry farm business.

Abiya is a housewife and her husband is a farmer who cultivates vegetables on their own farmland.  But the business does not provide them with much profit to lead a decent life.  Abiya's son has been running a poultry farm for the past five years.  Abiya also helps her son to run the business well.  This poultry farm is the primary source of income for the family, and they sell eggs in the market to cover the household expenses.  Abiya and her son enjoy farming because of the proceeds they get from selling their farm produce. To get more income, she has to expand her business.  But her biggest challenge is a lack of enough funds.

So Abiya took a loan to expand her poultry farm, which she says will lead to food security for her family. She wants to buy more chicks and chickens and their fodder with the loan.  She will sell more eggs in order to get more income, thus she will be able to help her family financially.

She dreams of improving her business with the loan in the future and she is grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chickens to boost the poultry farm.

loans.name: Ajuma

texts.en:
Ajuma is a very young housewife who is 28 years old.  She resides at the small village of Baroghoria with her husband, Maniruddin, and two children (one son and one daughter).  Both Ajuma and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only.  As they were deprived of an education, they are very much concerned with their children's education. The children are students in grade two and one.

Ajuma's husband is a farmer.  He grows vegetables and fruits like potatoes, beans, tomatoes, chilies, cucumber etc. on his farmland and sells his products in the local market.  He is the main breadwinner for the family.  As an additional source of income, Ajuma practices livestock breeding, a business which she began five years ago.   Now, she has two milking cows and a few goats.  Poverty can't curb Ajuma's indomitable spirit to get ahead in life.

With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to BJS (Kiva's partner) for a loan to purchase a cow and increase her number of livestock, which will allow her to increase the quantity of milk she sells and consequently, to improve her family's well-being.  She plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and wants to build a concrete-made house for her family. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking and energetic woman from the village of Baroghoria in the Jalpaiguri district.  She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter), who are students. The son is in college and the daughter reads in grade 12.   Amina and her husband are illiterate and can sign only their names. They have a small kachha house (made of wood, straw, mud and bamboo) of their own.

Amina's husband is a trader of cattle. He buys cattle from wholesale markets and sells them in the local market, but this hardly covers the household expenses.  To meet the necessary expenses for the family, Amina established an animal farm in her house. She really enjoys it and she has been at it for the last 10 years. She has a good many customers that she wants to satisfy with a regular supply of milk.  But her biggest challenge is lack of capital.

Amina took this loan from BJS to purchase another cow that will help her to generate more income. This will improve her family's living standard. She dreams of purchasing more cows to make a herd to strengthen her business.

She is grateful to her lenders (Kiva and BJS).

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma operates a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 80,000 which she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El señor Gonzalo es una persona pujante y muy amante de sus 4 hijos por los que ha hecho todo lo que está a su alcance para brindarle las mejores oportunidades de un buen futuro.
El se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras con el afán de buscar recursos para la manutención de familia, trabaja todos los días y es muy juicioso con sus gastos.
Actualmente desea inyectarle capital a su negocio comprando un amplio surtido de verduras como aguacates, plátanos y yuca, alimentos que le permitirán seguir con sus ventas y seguir brindando empleo a una persona que tiene contratada.
Es un individuo con ganas de progreso y matices de superación.
texts.en: Gonzalo  is a very driven person and very loved by his 4 children for whom he he makes in everything his goal in providing the best opportunities for their future. He sells fruits and vegetables with the goal of supporting his family. He works every day and is very careful with his spending. Today he wishes to add capital to his business to buy a wide stock of vegetables such as avocados, plantains and yuca, food that will enable him to continue with his sales and continue providing employment to a person he has contracted. He is an individual with the will and desire to succeed.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as avocados, plantains and yucas to stock his vegetable business.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly lives with her husband and two daughters in Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district. She is only 26 years old and studied up to fifth standard.  Her husband Ashish, 43 years old, has a secondary education.  Both her daughters are getting an education and they are in secondary school.

Jolly's husband is a carpenter who makes small wooden furniture like chairs, tables, stools etc. and sells to his neighbors. He runs the business from his house. Jolly is a very energetic and dedicated woman.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for the last five years. She buys baby goats from her fellow farmers, especially when they have financial setbacks and want quick cash.  She buys them at a fairly low price and feeds them until they are mature.  Then she sells them to the butchers in the local markets. In this way, she helps her husband to run the family smoothly.  In order to generate more income to cope with the growing expenses of her family, she wants to expand the business but lacks the capital.

She heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and asked for a loan from them to purchase more baby goats. She hopes, with this financial help, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She wants to grow this business with the purchase of more goats in the future.

She gives her heartiest thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a 29-year-old woman married to Shankar. They live with their four daughters in the remote village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. Anima is uneducated and can sign only her name, but her husband studied up to grade nine. Three of their daughters go to school and they are in grade 6, 4 and 2.  The fourth daughter is too young for school.

Anima's husband owns a cycle-van (a kind of transport used in rural areas for carrying goods and people).  He earns money by driving the cycle-van.  He is the only earning member for the family, but the income is modest and hardly enough to manage the household expenses.  So they thought of purchasing a new van and they are planning to give the old one on hire for carrying goods and people for additional income.

Anima has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cycle-van for her husband who is a young, enthusiastic and energetic person with a great desire to provide her family members with a normal standard of life. She hopes this will give her financial stability.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband's business

loans.name: Mayda

texts.es: Mayda es soltera pero tiene un hijo ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe  que le pertenece a sus familiares Mayda es comerciante y quiere comprar cafe, te, detergentes y otros productos para su tienda Mayda es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Mayda is single but has a son. She lives in El Alto in an adobe house that belongs to her family. Mayda is a merchant and wants to buy coffee, tea, detergents and other products for her store. Mayda is the only source of income in her household which is why she needs assistance.

loans.use: to buy coffee, tea, detergents and other products for her store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 34-year-old married lady and she has been blessed with six children. She has been in the business of selling clothes for 12 years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. Her spouse provides additional income for the family. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more stock of clothes for sale. She will use the profits to improve her living standard. This is her first loan. She hopes in future to prosper in her business and family.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a lady who is married and the mother of three children. She has been in the green grocery business for a while now and she says her business would have been far had it not been for the lack of capital to ensure a steady supply of vegetables to her business.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 10,000 which she plans to use to buy fruits in season for retail selling to her clients. She plans to use the extra income generated to pay for school fees for her children who are still in school and also to expand her business.

In the future she would like to see her business flourish and become steady.

loans.use: to buy fruits in season in bulk

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: She is 38 years old. She has two children. She has been in business for six years. Her monthly income is 8,000 Kenyan Shillings. She will be using the loan to buy seedlings. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees. This is her third loan. She paid the previous loan successfully. Her dream for the future is to live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El señor Pascual, es una persona de 69 años de edad,  se dedica a Agricultura y Caficultura, el señor Pascual se creció con sus abuelos que se dedicaban a la caficultura, ellos trabajaron y dedicaron toda su vida a realizar esta actividad.

De esta manera el señor Pascual adquirió conocimiento y experiencia de sus abuelos quienes le inculcaron buenos valores y principios que son los que lo han llevado a continuar desempeñando esta actividad que por años se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, la que le ha servido para llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Y de esta forma pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y les pudo dar todo lo necesario, ahora ellos son unas personas de bien y de trabajo que de todas las maneras ayudan a su papá.


Él tiene una experiencia de casi toda la vida ya que lo ha realizado desde que era un niño realizando trabajos en la caficultura, se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, actividad que aprendió de sus abuelos quienes se sentían orgullosos de cultivar la tierra día a día, y él era quien los acompañaba todos los días a la finca llevando una Cuma, un azadón y una calabaza con agua siendo estos sus implemento de trabajo.

El decidió dedicarse a este trabajo motivado por sus abuelos, y porque fue una herencia que le dejaron y que hoy en día quiere dejar a uno de sus nietos a quien ha crecido y ha educado con mucho amor y disciplina. Y es quien le ayuda en las tareas de la caficultura.

El dinero será utilizado en compra de semilla mejorada de café, ya que tiene una parcela donde hará un vivero, para posteriormente trasplantarlas  al terreno. Puesto que las plantas de mayor edad fueron atacadas por una plaga llamada roya, de esta forma renovara su finca y dará vida  a nuevas parcelas de cafetal que se han convertido en el patrimonio de su familia.

Las proyecciones que tiene son las de apoyar en los estudios a sus nietos,  ya que manifiesta que uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando en la escuela nacional de agricultura. Contribuir a la reforestación de su comunidad, mediante la inversión del crédito y sus ganancias y enseñar a su nieto a trabajar la caficultura, ya que él será quien siga sus pasos en la caficultura.
texts.en:
Señor Pascual is a 69-year-old farmer and coffee grower who was raised by his grandparents. They spent their lives growing coffee and took great pride in farming the land every day. Señor Pascual's grandparents passed on to him their knowledge, experience, and the sound values and principles that have allowed him to follow in their path. When he was a young boy, Señor Pascual's grandparents taught him how to grow coffee, and he went with them to the fields each day, carrying the tools of the coffee farmer: a machete, a mattock, and a pumpkin filled with water.  

Señor Pascual followed in the path that his grandparents made, deciding to become a coffee grower himself. This was why his grandparents left him their coffee plantation. Señor Pascual has accumulated nearly a lifetime of experience growing coffee, which has become his main source of income and allowed him to meet his family's daily needs. Señor Pascual has been able to raise his children and provide them with everything they needed; the children are now honest, hardworking people who support their father in every way. 

Just as his grandparents passed on their knowledge, experience, and land to him, Señor Pascual now wants to leave the plantation to a grandson, whom he has raised and educated with a great deal of discipline and love.  

Señor Pascual will use the funds from this loan to purchase improved coffee seeds for a  plot of land where he'll start a nursery. He will then transplant the coffee plants to the fields, replacing older coffee plants that were infected with a blight called rust. The new plants will rejuvenate the plantation, which has become the family's heritage.  

Señor Pascual plans to support the education of his grandchildren, one of whom is studying at the national agricultural school. He also believes that  the investments that he makes with the funds from this loan, his earnings, and training his grandson to grow coffee will contribute to the reforestation of his community. Señor Pascual's grandson will be the one to follow in the path his grandparents started as coffee growers.

loans.use: to purchase improved coffee seeds for a plot of land where he'll start a nursery before transplanting the coffee plants to the fields.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated an open air food business, selling to her neighbors and students in a neighboring school. In addition she also does farming business which is her other source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar for her food preparation business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar for her food preparation business

loans.name: Khirodini

texts.en:
Khirodini is a 44-year-old married woman with two sons.
She is from the village of Kothapara in the Jalpaiguri district where she lives with her children and husband, Bidhan, in their own house. Khirodini has a primary education but could not continue further due to her parents' poor economic resources.  Her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name.  One of their sons is in grade 9 and the other is grown up and unemployed.

Khirodini's husband is a farmer. He has a small piece of land where he grows vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, beans, potatoes etc. He has been doing this for more than 10 years.  His son and wife help him in his work. They carry the products to the local markets for sale.  This is the only source of income for the family.  In order to give a little more financial sustenance, he wants to cultivate other vegetables and fruits.  At present, he wants to cultivate cucumber, which is a fruit in great demand.  His main challenge is capital

Khirodini heard about Kiva’s Partner, BJS, from her neighbors and has applied for financial assistance with an aim to grow their agribusiness. She will use the loan for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes this will allow her to earn additional income to run her family smoothly.

She wants to set aside some money from the profit to build a concrete-made house for them.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating cucumber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more phone accessories in order to strengthen the business of his store

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is the married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zawadi operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her village. In addition she sells fish to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for the transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for the transport.

loans.name: Jorge Ángel

texts.es: Jorge tiene 45 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, sus tres hijas de 17 años, 15 años, 2 años y su hijo de de 12 años de edad. Jorge trabaja como ganadero, compra y vende ganado. De esta forma se gana al vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. Jorge desea construir una pila y un baño con regadera para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales como: arena, ladrillo, cemento, etc.
texts.en: Jorge is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and three daughters aged 17, 15, and 2 years, and his son who is 12 years old. Jorge works as a farmer, buying and selling cattle. He makes his living this way and sustains the household and gives his family the necessities. Jorge wants to build a bathroom with a sink and shower which is why he is asking for a loan through FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of the supplies such as sand, bricks, cement, etc.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, etc. in order to build a sink, and bathroom with shower.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is still running the clothes store but she also opened a computer accessories business as a secondary business in her area. She is currently married and has one daughter from her marriage. She says that she is happy that the previous loan was able to help her expand her business.

Currently, she has applied for her second loan of KES 13,500 which she plans to use to add more stock of computer accessories. She plans to use the anticipated profits to save towards her daughter's education as well as expand her business.

In the future she would like to have more income so that she can open more businesses in other sectors as well as have her family enjoy a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to add stock of computer accessories

loans.name: Jepkemoi

texts.en:
She is 35 years old and married. She has two children. She has been in the business of selling timber for three or so years. Her monthly income is KES 65,000. She has borrowed a loan to buy more timber to sell.

She will use the anticipated profits to buy more timber to sell. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes and dreams in the future are for her business to expand and her family members to be self dependent.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en: Majeda is a separated woman in her 40s'. She lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Al-Zarqa. She is working on buying blankets and also detergents and reselling them to gain a profit. After Majeda caught the idea of selling new products such as clothes and new types of blankets, she has applied for this loan to buy them.

loans.use: To buy clothes and blankets to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. She has 1 son and 2 daughters. She has been selling clothes and accessories for 2 years at her home. But because of the external competition and the lack of funding, she applied for youth loan so she can have an independent shop and buy more products to raise her profits and attract more customers.

loans.use: have an independent clothes and accessories shop and buy more products

loans.name: Malak

texts.en: Malak is a conservative woman so her husband took the picture instead of her. Malak is 21 years old married woman who lives with her husband in a sector in Jordan called Al- Zarqa. She and her husband Jameel have been buying Saudi products especially fuel and selling them at their home for 5 years. Now her husband owns a store where he sells their products. She applied for a youth loan so they can import larger quantities of their products and open another store to increase their income.

loans.use: To import more Saudi products and fuel to sell

loans.name: Lagarto Group

texts.es:
MARY, madre abandonada vive con sus 4 hijos. Desde hace más de 10 años ella tiene una farmacia veterinaria. Con la cual se apoya para solventar los gastos de alimentación salud y educación de sus hijos.
Ella goza de buena aceptación en los productos de su farmacia por ser la única en su comunidad. 
Con el presente crédito ella desea abastecerse de fertilizantes- fungicidas- bactericidas y otros productos más que son de gran utilidad para su comunidad. Ya que en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Ella está segura de que de esta manera, servirá mejor a su comunidad.
MARY. Desea  crecer en su negocio y con sus ganancias poder terminar de construir su casa. En un futuro poder comprar un carro y una casa en Santo Domingo.  
Sus hijos tienen deseos de continuar sus estudios y llegar a ser: ingeniero civil, modelo, ingeniero en sistemas, y cantante.
Todos los integrantes de este grupo, son de la misma comunidad y tienen negocios diferentes todos tienen deseos de servir a su comunidad ofreciéndoles productos a bajo costo y de muy buena calidad.
la lider del grupo se encuentra levantando la mano y la madre del niño quiso salir con el en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Mary, an abandoned wife, lives with her 4 children.  She's had a veterinary pharmacy for 10 years.  With this business she covers the food, health and educational expenses of her children.

Mary's business is well-accepted, because it's the only one of its kind in the community.  With this loan, she wants to stock up on fertilizers, fungicides, bactericides, and other products that are of great use in her community.  This is because most of the residents work in farming and animal husbandry.  Mary is sure that in this way she can better serve her community.

Mary wants to grow her business, and with the earnings, finish building her house.  In the future, she wants to buy a car and a house in Santo Domingo.  Mary's children want to continue with their education and become: a civil engineer, a model, a systems engineer, and a singer.  

All of the members of this group are from the same community, and they have different businesses.  They all want to serve their community, offering products at low cost and of very good quality.  The leader of this group is raising her hand, and the mother of the child wanted to include him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy farming and veterinary products for her business

loans.name: Decy Maricela

texts.es: Maricela es una señora colombiana que es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 18 años que se encuentran estudiando, Maricela vive en el campo y se dedica a la agricultura y va a emprender el negocio de crianza de chanchos, ya que una vecina le anima a este negocio y le dice que es muy rentable, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para de aquí obtener un ingreso mas para sus gastos y los de sus hijos.
texts.en: Maricela is a Colombian woman who is married and has two children, 16  and 18 years old, who are in school.  Maricela lives in the country and works in agriculture. She is starting a business raising pigs, since a neighbor has encouraged her to do so and told her that it's very profitable.  She will use the loan to buy pigs in order to earn a larger income for her expenses and her children's.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: María Emerita

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado, es madre de dos hijos, se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde sus 14 años de edad y su esposo trabaja en un restaurante tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian 8º y 5º grado, los dos dependen de ella.


El préstamo lo invertirá en consolidar una deuda, con el objetivo de pagar menos intereses, y tener mejores ingresos para alimentar su familia.


Desea darle el estudio a sus hijos, y seguir trabajando con créditos que le permitan pagar menos intereses y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old. She studied through 4th grade. She is the mother of two children. She has been doing domestic chores for fourteen years and her husband works in a restaurant. She has two children depending on her who are in the 8th and 5th grades.

The loan will be used for debt consolidation with the objective of paying less interest providing more income in order to feed her family. 

She wants her give her children an education and continue working through loans permitting her to pay less interest and give a better life to her children.

loans.use: to consolidate her debt, paying less interest and providing her family with more income

loans.name: Kotognogontala 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame SAFIATOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences  4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  140 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA 5 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Fachoribougou,  a village located in the commune of Kaboila, Cercle of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are now on their eleventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Safiatou, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is the woman in the middle of the front row.  She plans to use her loan to buy some seeds, four 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, four cans of herbicide, and also to cover the cost of plowing to maintain one hectare of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in Sikasso and in her village, to both men and women who pay her in cash and sometimes on credit. She is expecting to make an average profit of 140,000 CFA francs per planting season. Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and the interest, and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, farm inputs, seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame WORIATA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA 6 group are married women who are, on average, 33 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village located in the commune of Kaboila, Cercle of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are now on their eleventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Woriata, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is first from the right in the front row. She plans to use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and also to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 0.25 hectare of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in Sikasso and in her village, to both men and women who pay her in cash and sometimes on credit. She is expecting to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per planting season. Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and the interest, and to help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm inputs, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame SARAN assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA  4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  140 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotognogontala 4 group are married women averaging 43 years of age, with three children. They live mainly in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in the  township of Kaboila, district of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
