They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their activities during the rainy season.

They are on their 11th agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans.
They grown peanuts, which is what Mrs. Saran does, for example. She is the second one seated from left to right in the group photo. With her loan, she plans to buy four 50-kg [110 lbs] bags of fertilizers, four jugs of herbicide and pay the cost of labor to work 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land.
She plans to earn an average of 140,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle.
This  revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and use the rest to help her husband with everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other agricultural inputs and pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a 32-year-old lady who is married to Isaac and a mother to two children. She has been selling cereals for the last seven years and has been making a monthly income of Kenya shillings 30,000.

She has applied for her fourth loan with Visionfund Kenya, which she plans to use to add more stock of cereals as she is running low. She plans to use the income produced to educate her children and expand her business.

In the future she would like to see her children educated to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To add more stock of cereals

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 38-year-old lady. She is married to Charles, and they have been blessed with two children. She has been running her retail business selling different things, including clothes, for the last four years, and makes a monthly profit of 18,300 Kenyan shillings.

This is Peninah's fourth loan cycle with VisionFund Kenya, and she plans to use the whole amount to add more stock of clothes for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to save towards the education of her children as well as expand her business. She plans to have a life with stability in business.

loans.use: To add more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: Jose tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos que ya son independientes, se dedica 4 años a la fabricación de bloque y de ladrillo, también se dedica a trabajo de albañilería y a la agricultura, comenta que para quedar bien en sus pagos este señor le hace cualquier tipo de trabajo, Jose  va a invertir el crédito en la compra de cemento y otros materiales para la fabricación de sus productos, Jose sueña con poder ayudar a sus nietos en la educación, casa y alimento.
texts.en:
Jose is 57 years old. He lives with his wife and has two children who are now independent. He has been engaged in making blocks and bricks for 4 years. He is also a mason and farmer. He notes that in order to keep up to date in his payments he does whatever kind of work he can.

Jose will invest the loan in the purchase of cement and other materials to make his products. He dreams of being able to help his grandchildren with their education, housing and food.

loans.use: to purchase cement.

loans.name: Guillermo Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro es un joven que tiene una discapacidad en el lado derecho de su cuerpo, el es soltero y vive con sus padres y se dedica a la ganadería y  trabaja en un tractor en trabajos del campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para tenerla en un terreno que tiene su padre, Alejandro dice que su incapacidad no le impide trabajar, su aspiración es seguir sobrellevando su enfermedad y luchar por su vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a young man who is disabled on the right side of his body. He is single and lives with his parents. He makes a living raising livestock and he also runs a tractor on agricultural jobs.

He will use the loan to purchase a cow to have on a plot of land his father owns. Alejandro says that his disability does not prevent him from working. His goal is to continue coping with his illness and fighting for his life.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Wilmar Augusto

texts.es: Wilmar es un hombre de 36 años de edad dedico desde muy joven a la cría de ganado bovino actividad que realiza a la par con un trabajo independiente como conductor de moto-carro, ya que esta actividad agraria aparte de ser un negocio que ha transcendido de generación en generación le genera espacios de tiempo que puede aprovechar en otras actividades. Solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado lo que le permitirá participar en diferentes actividades exponiendo sus ganados a posibl4es compradores en ferias que realizan y que necesita ciertos requisitos para ingresar, con la ayuda de este crédito puede explorar este campo que le puede traer muchos beneficios para su vida personal y laboral, permitiéndole tener una excelente calidad de vida para él y su familia, la cual con trabajo ha estado logrando poco a poco
texts.en:
Wilmar is 36 and has raised cattle since he was very young, but also has a second business driving a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi. Raising cattle has been a family tradition, passed down from generation to generation, as well as a business. Raising cattle also allows Wilmar time for other pursuits. 

Wilmar is applying for a loan for the purchase of livestock that will allow him to take part in different activities, such as showing his cattle to possible buyers at fairs. These events have entry requirements, and with the help of this loan, Wilmar can try to sell cattle, which could bring great personal and professional benefits to him. Success in the cattle business would allow Wilmar and his family to enjoy an excellent quality of life, which he's been striving for and achieving gradually each day.

loans.use: to buy cattle to boost up and establish himself as an entrepreneur, allowing him to participate in different fairs which have requirements that he can cover with this loan.

loans.name: Henrry Mauricio

texts.es:
Henry es un mecánico el cual ha ejercido su profesión por más de 20 años, actividad que aprendió, mediante la observación y la práctica empírica. Nunca ha tomado un curso en mecánica pero sus trabajos son impecables e incluso muy solicitados. Es un hombre muy preocupado por su familia, destacado por su responsabilidad y su gran sentido de humor. Aparte de la mecánica tiene una pequeña granja con animales la cual no la considera una actividad económica sino como un hobby porque se considera un amante al campo y los animales y trata siempre de estar rodeado de este entorno. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos, estos serían lo más comunes y pedidos por los clientes ya que busca minimizar el tiempo de arreglo de un automóvil o motocicleta teniendo a la mano el material necesario para realizar la reparación lo que le traerían gran beneficios pues el índice de satisfacción por el servicio de los clientes aumentaría considerablemente
texts.en:
Henry is a mechanic who has been in this field for more than 20 years, an activity he learned by observation and empirical practice. He has never taken a course in mechanics but his work is impeccable and much in demand. He is a man who is concerned for his family, noted for his dependability and great sense of humor. Besides mechanics he has a small farm with animals which he does not consider a financial activity but a hobby because he is a lover of the countryside and animals and always tries to be surrounded by this environment.

He is asking for a loan to buy the most common spare parts requested by his clients as he is looking for a way to minimize the time of fixing a car or motorcycle, having on hand the necessary part in order to do the repair thereby bringing great benefits for customer satisfaction as his service to the clients would increase considerably.

loans.use: To buy commonly requested spare parts required for repairing cars or motorcycles to implement a strategy of being able to do faster repairs thereby increasing customer satisfaction

loans.name: August

texts.en: August is a 61-year-old gentleman; he is married, and the father of 5 adult children. He has been running his retail shop for the last 5 years and he says business is not bad. He has applied for his fourth loan with VisionFund, which he plans to use to add more stock of cooking oil and flour for his business. He plans to use the income to pay college fees for his last-born child. In the future he will be happy to see his business grow.

loans.use: to add stock of cooking oil and flour for his business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has no electricity or piped water. She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married and has 4 children. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and fees for her school-going kids. 

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. In addition, she sells food in a kiosk and has dairy cows. With her KES 50,000 loan Gladys wants to purchase cloth and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: Jader es un joven de 25 años de edad con los más altos deseos de superación y de brindarle lo mejor a su hijo y a su pareja con la que convive. Jader cuando tenía 15 años comenzó a trabajar la tierra, es decir, a dedicarse a la siembra de maíz y frijoles, actividad que le ayudado a la manutención de su familia. Gracias a un primer financiamiento otorgado por KIVA_MICREDITO logro tener un buena producción, vender una parte de ella y almacenar otra para la alimentación de su familia. Actualmente solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos como abono urea, venenos,  refrescantes y semilla de maíz y frijol de excelente calidad. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de gran ayuda para garantizar la siembra de sus semillas y darles un mejor apoyo a su mi familia. Después de haber cancelado el actual préstamo, desea obtener otro nuevamente ya que considera que los préstamos siempre son necesarios para garantizar una excelente producción.
texts.en: Jader is a 25-year-old young man with the highest desires for self-improvement and to offer the best to his child and his partner with whom he lives.  Jader, when he was 15 years old, began to work the land.  That is to say, to work growing corn and beans, a job that has helped in the provision for his family.  Thanks to the first loan granted by Kiva MiCredito, he managed to have a good crop, to sell part of it and store the other part to feed his family. At the moment he asks for a new loan to purchase supplies such as urea, manure, pesticide, refreshers, and excellent quality corn and bean seeds. He is expecting that the loan requested will be a great help to him to guarantee the planting of his seeds and will provide better support for his family. After he has paid off the current loan, he wants to get another new one since he considers loans always needed to guarantee an excellent crop.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as urea, manure, pesticide, refreshers, and excellent quality corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es: Juan Ramón es un señor de 62 años de edad, casado y con 4 hijos quienes tienen a su cargo. Juan tiene como actividad principal y fuente de ingreso para toda su familia la venta de electrodomésticos actividad a la que se ha dedicado hace más de 24 años. Con su actual negocio ha logrado salir adelante y ser un gran ejemplo de superación para sus hijos. Juan desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de equipos de sonidos, televisores, planchas, memorias USB, abanicos entre otros productos. Estimando que el préstamo será de muchísima ayuda ya que con las ganancias obtenidas podrá pagar los gastos de estudios sus hijos. Sus principales metas son hacer crecer ser su negocio y expandir su negocio hacia otros departamentos del país.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón is 62 years old, married with 4 children who are in his care. Juan’s principal activity and source of family income is the sale of appliances, and he has been doing this work for more than 24 years. He has managed to get ahead in his business and is a great example of success for his children. Juan wants to apply for a loan to buy sound equipment, televisions, irons, USB flash drives, fans and other products.

He thinks the loan will be a big help and with his earnings he will be able to pay the educational costs for his children. His main goals are to grow his business and to expand to other areas of the country.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment, televisions, irons, USB flash drives, fans and other products.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo uno de ellos vive con ella y es discapacitado, Margarita se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace 40 años, es una señora muy responsable con sus pagos y con su familia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementar en sus chancheras, lo que Margarita aspira es seguir  adelante en su negocio para tener una vida digna y apoyar  a su hijo que tiene esta discapacidad.
texts.en:
Margarita is 64 years old. She is married and has six children of whom only one, who is disabled, lives with her. 

Margarita has been raising pigs for 40 years. She is a lady who is very responsible with her payments and with her family.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs in order to increase her stock. Margarita’s goal is to continue moving her business forward so that she can have a decent life and support her son, who is disabled.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Suena el timbre de receso y los niños de primaria llegan alegres al quiosco de Marvin, lugar donde encuentran sus dulces, galletas y refrescos favoritos; siempre quedan satisfechos por la atención de calidad que reciben. Tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos. Es un hombre emprendedor y amable, hace cinco años inició su primer negocio en una escuela de su comunidad, le ha ido muy bien pero requiere más ingresos para la salud y educación de sus hijos, por lo que decidió abrir una venta de fritanga en su casa.  
Marvin solicita un crédito para la compra de una cocina industrial, que le permita cocinar una mayor cantidad  de comida con el objetivo de obtener más clientes y mejores ingresos. Espera unir la venta de fritanga con el quiosco y así ofrecer variedad de productos. Su esposa, quién es su mano derecha, lo motiva a seguir adelante, juntos luchan para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The recess bell sounds and the primary school children arrive happily at Marvin's kiosk, a place where they find their favorite sweets, cookies, and soft drinks; they are always satisfied with the quality of service they get. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He is an enterprising and friendly man; five years ago he began his first business at a school in his community. It has gone very well, but he needs more income for his children's health and education, and for this reason he decided to open a fried food restaurant in his house. 

Marvin asks for a loan to purchase an industrial range, which will permit him to cook a larger quantity of food with the objective to get more customers and better income. He hopes to combine his fried food sales with the kiosk and in that way offer a variety of products. His wife, who is his right hand, motivates him to keep going, and together they fight to offer the family better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial range.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts, underwear and children's clothing which will allow the business to constantly develop and bring better income to her family.

loans.name: Elvia De Jesus

texts.es: Elvia es una trabajadora mujer de 61 años de edad quien junto con su esposo logro comprar un terreno y construir la casa donde actualmente vive, no tiene hijos lo que en cierta parte la ha beneficiado para emprender diferentes tipos de proyectos. Hoy en día al ser una mujer ya de avanzada edad le es muy complicado conseguir trabajo por lo que cualquier ingreso que no venga de su pareja tiene que buscárselo por sus propios medios por tal razón solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía como ropa y productos de belleza con el objetivo de generar su propio capital en base a su  trabajo sintiéndose productiva y aportante no solo en su hogar si no en su familia
texts.en: Elvia is a hardworking woman of 61 years of age who lives with her husband and they were able to buy land and build a house where they currently live. She does not have children to help her with various types of projects. Today being a woman of advanced age it is very complicated to continue to work for a bit of income that does not come from her partner. She has to search on her own so for this reason she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing and beauty products with the objective of generating her own income on the basis of her work, feeling productive and a contributor to the family household.

loans.use: To buy clothing and beauty supplies to open her own business so she can provide income to the household and can feel more useful at home

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es: Carlos un hombre determinante en sus sueños que no solo se conforma con pensar el que podría pasar si hiciera eso si no que efectuar sus acciones, una gran característica del joven Carlos quien a sus 24 años tiene la idea de comenzar su propio negocio, un almacén de ropa que le permita generar ingresos para cumplir sus proyectos de vida y lo más importante siempre apoyándose en sus propios esfuerzos para lograr sus metas sin tener que pedir limosna pues sabe que tiene todas las herramientas para ser algo en la vida, ser una persona que se destaque por su determinación a la hora de trazarse una meta. Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio almacén de ropa que le permita seguir teniendo la ilusión de soñar de aspirar a grandes cosas que en ocasiones necesitan capital, que le permita estudiar y mantener su hogar solicita un crédito que le dé la posibilidad de independizarse y no depende de un tercero.
texts.en: Carlos is man who is decisive in his dreams that not only settle for thinking of what could happen if he did this, but to carry out his actions. This is a great characteristic of the young Carlos who, at 24 years old, has the idea to begin his own business, a clothing shop that will allow him to generate income to realize his life goals and, most important, always supporting himself in his own efforts to meet his goals without having to beg for money since he knows that he has all the tools to be something in his life, to be a person who stands out by his determination at the moment of setting a goal for himself. He asks for a loan to open his own clothing shop that will permit him to continue having the eagerness of dreaming of aspiring to great things that sometimes need capital, which permit him to study and maintain his household. He asks for a loan that will allow him the possibility of making himself independent and not depending on anyone else.

loans.use: to open his own clothing store with the idea of being an independent person and master of his own resources.

loans.name: Monawar

texts.en: Monawar is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. She is a mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Monawar has been working in embroidery for 5 years at her home. But because of her need to buy more tools for her work and to open an independent shop, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more tools for her embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products such as clothing and accessories to sell by catalog.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. Her house has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years Nancy has raised chickens to earn an income. She mentioned outbreaks of disease as a challenge in the chicken business.

Nancy joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is applying for a 25,000 KES loan to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She hopes to become a poultry wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman blessed with two children, all of whom attend school. Her house has electricity and piped water.

For the past five years Salma has raised chickens to earn an income. She mentioned outbreaks of disease as a challenge in the chicken business.

Salma joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is applying for a 25,000 KES loan to purchase more chicks to raise.

loans.use: to purchase chicks for her business

loans.name: Glady Del Socorro

texts.es:
El canto de los gallos despierta toda las mañanas a Glady de 36 años, quien junto a su marido han comprado una pulpería en una finca donde cuidan. Anteriormente ellos eran unos trabajadores más en la finca, sin embargo, los administradores antes puestos ya no podían seguir por su edad, entonces fueron ellos elegidos para cuidar y vender en la pulpería que estaba en el lugar. Sin dudarlo lo aceptaron, pues con el salario de trabajadores de la finca no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus dos hijos.   
Ahora tienen 6 años de tener su propia pulpería y solicita un préstamo para invertir en su mercadería, y comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche y otros productos que a diario le comprar sus clientes. Afortunadamente Glady no tiene competencia, por lo que le va bastante bien, además su amabilidad hace que sus clientes estén satisfechos. Entre sus planes esta seguir creciendo para terminar de construir su inodoro.
texts.en:
The rooster's crow wakes Glady, 36 years old, every morning.  Along with her husband, she has purchased a general store in the farm they manage.  previously, they were just more workers on the farm, however, the previous managers could not continue anymore because of their age, then they were selected to care for and make sales in the general store that was at the place. Without hesitating, they accepted it, since the salary for workers on the farm was not sufficient to pay for the household expenses and their two children's education.

Now they have had their own general store for 6 years and ask for a loan to invest in their merchandise, purchasing basic staples such as rice, beans, bread, milk, and other products that their customers purchase daily.  Luckily, Glady doesn't have any competition, so it is going fairly well. In addition, her friendliness makes her customers satisfied. Among her plans are to continue growing in order to finish the construction of a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples such as rice, beans, bread, milk and other products.

loans.name: José Segundo

texts.es:
En un pequeño cuarto, se alojan distintos productos básicos del hogar. Leche, pan, verduras, arroz, sopas, jugos, entre otros, que mantienen la economía de José, de 62 años. Un hombre trabajador, que desde que terminó la primaria, ha trabajado. Don José inició su primer negocio precisamente a los 30 años con una pulpería en su finca, sin embargo sus deseos de superarse lo hicieron moverse a la ciudad y tuvo que vender la propiedad. Con el dinero que le sobró compró un puesto de frutas y verduras en el mercado. Luego prefirió venderlo y compró una propiedad donde inició de nuevo con una pulpería, pues ese era su sueño. Ahora lleva 18 años con su negocio y única fuente de ingresos de este hombre soltero con tres hijos, todos independientes.
Don José trabaja solo, por lo que necesita de un préstamo para invertir en su capital de trabajo, comprar arroz, frijoles, papas, pan, leche, entre otros productos que son de mayor demanda en su pulpería. Él considera que al tener más mercancías, se incrementará las ventas y por ende sus ingresos.  Esto le ayudará a cumplir con su meta de ampliar el local para tener más espacio para la mercadería y hacer mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
In a small room there are a variety of basic food items. Milk, bread, vegetables, rice, soups, juices amongst others that maintain José's finances. He's a 62 year old hard-working man who has worked since he completed his primary schooling.

José opened his first business precisely 30 years ago, a small store on his farm. However his desire to get ahead made him move to the city and he had to sell his property. With the money he had he bought a fruit and vegetable stand in the market. Later he decided to sell it and buy a property where he started another small store, as this was his dream.

He has had this business for 18 years and it is the only source of income for this single man who has 3 children, all of them now independent. José works alone and he needs a loan to invest in working capital buying rice, beans, potatoes, bread, milk amongst other products that are in high demand at his store. He thinks that having more merchandise will increase his sales and in the end his profits. This will help him fulfill his goal of expanding his store to have more space for merchandise and make improvements on his house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, potatoes, bread, milk etc.

loans.name: Elsy Emeli

texts.es:
Elsy de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta 3 grado,  es casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y también al cuidado de ganado ya que compra para repastar para luego vender a un mejor precio y obtener ingresos para darle los estudios a su hija de 16 años quien esta sacando segundo año de bachillerato.  Elsy tiene 2 hijas quienes le apoyan con los oficios domésticos de la casa y una de ellas  estudia y la nieta esta estudia kinder  y quien están a cargo de ella y su esposo, ademas tiene dos hijos varones que no viven con ella.


Elsy  se dedica al cuidado de los animales de la casa como son las gallinas, cerdos y ganado  los cuales los alimenta para luego venderlos cuando están gordos de esta manera sigue adelante con su familia y hogar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 2 novillas para dejar para que con el tiempo le puedan producir leche para hacer queso y poderlo vender en el caserío obteniendo otro ingreso adicional.

El objetivo de Elsy es seguir mejorando su condición de vida y poderle seguir dando los estudios a su hija y nieta para que pueda superarse y salir bien con el crédito con la institución para seguir teniendo las puertas abierta cuando lo necesite y que los resultados de la siembra de los cultivos le sean productivos.
texts.en:
Elsy is 50 years old. She studied through third grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture planting basic grains such as corn, beans, and also has livestock, for grazing, to sell later at a better price and to obtain income in order to provide an education for their 16 year old daughter who is in the second year of high school. Elsy has 2 children who help her with the household chores and one of them studies and the granddaughter is in kindergarten and she and her husband are responsible for her. She also has two sons who do not live with her.

Elsy cares for the household animals such as chickens, pigs, and cattle which she feeds for later sale selling them when they are fattened and this way she can support her family and home.

The loan that that she is asking for is to buy two heifers leaving them for the time when they can produce milk for making cheese to sell in the village obtaining additional income.

Elsy’s objective is to continue improving their living conditions and to be able to continue paying educational fees for her daughter and her granddaughter and that she will succeed and do well with the loan from the institution in order to continue having open doors when needed, and to have a productive harvest.

loans.use: to buy two heifers, waiting for the time when they can produce milk for making cheese

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.es:
Mirasol tiene 39 años de edad, no estudió ya que sus padres no disponían de los recursos necesarios para darle los estudios, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos a cargo quienes estudian en el cantón.

Mirasol se dedica al cuidado de los animales de la casa como son las gallinas y cerdos los cuales los alimenta para luego venderlos cuando están gordos de esta manera sigue adelante con su familia y hogar de los cuales obtiene ingresos para darle los estudios a sus 2 hijos, también recibe apoyo de su esposo, para comprar los productos para cuidar de su familia Mirasol camina 50 minutos, y luego toma un bus lo cual  tarda 20 minutos para llegar al pueblo mas cercano.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y poderlos fertilizar cuando ya tenga los 8 a 10 diez de nacida la planta.


Su sueño es seguir mejorando su condición de vida y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Mirasol is 39 years old. She didn't go to school since her parents didn't have the necessary resources to provide her with schooling. Her husband works in agriculture, they have two children in their care, who study in the canton.

Marisol works taking care of animals at the house such as hens and pigs which she feeds in order to later sell them when they are fat, and in this way to continue onward with her family and household, and from which she gets income in order to provide her children with schooling. She also gets help from her husband to purchase the products to care for the family. Marisol walks 50 minutes then rides a bus, which takes 20 minutes, to get to the nearest town.

She will use the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to plant the corn and to be able to fertilize them when the plants are about 8-10 days old.

Her dream is to continue improving her living conditions and that her children continue studying.

loans.use:
to purchase agricultural supplies to plant corn and to be able to fertilize them 
when the plants are about 8-10 days old.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 24 years old, married and blessed with a child who is two years old. She has been running a cosmetics and mobile-money-transfer business for the last three years. Her income from both businesses is 15,000 Kenyan Shillings per month. She is currently applying for her second loan from Visionfund Kenya which she plans to use to buy more cosmetics including braids, perfumes, shoes, slippers and other items. She would also like to buy mobile phone spare parts and mobile credits to sell. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to open another mobile-money-transfer shop and expand her business. Her goal for the future is to be a very successful businesswoman and educate her son to an advanced level.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and mobile phone spare parts and credits to sell.

loans.name: Arli Antonio

texts.es:
Vacas y toros de todos los colores, caminan por toda la finca de Arli, un hombre agropecuario de 32 años de edad. Padre de dos hijos de 13 y 3 años, ambos estudiantes activos porque para él, la educación es de donde hay que partir para emprender. Empezó trabajando en Costa Rica, en cada corte de café y piña, lo que le permitió ahorrar y aprovechar esa ganancia para comprar vacas y terneros, así poder venderlos y ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche. 
Arli cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, con quien distribuye su producto en su casa. Para amortiguar un poco los gastos, utiliza el dinero que siempre ahorra para colocar un servicio de billares, el cual sirve de mucho cuando no es temporada baja. En estos momentos, necesita de un préstamo para comprar una vaca haiga dado a luz, que le servirá para amamantar unos terneros que tiene. Entre los planes de este hombre multifacético está, seguir ahorrando para comprar un taxi.
texts.en:
Cows and bulls of all colors wander around Arli's farm. He is a 32 year old farmer and father of two children aged 3 and 13. Both of them study as education for Arli is the beginning point for life. He started working in Costa Rica during each coffee and pineapple harvest which allowed him to save money. and he took advantage of this money to buy cows and calves. He could sell them and milk the cows and sell the milk. Arli has the help of his wife with whom he distributes their product from their house.

To soften the burden of their expenses a bit, he used the money he had saved to buy a pool table which is quite useful when it is not the off season. At this time he needs a loan to buy a pregnant cow which he can use to nurse a few calves he has. Amongst the plans this man of many talents has is to continue to save money and buy a taxi

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 32 years old. This new loan will help in the construction of a warehouse or storage place for maize products. The structures are waiting for the harvest to be purchased by the buyers. This infrastructure will help the entire community to have a secure storage place for their produce in the future.

UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the financing of the production of storage units which are significantly saving & protecting their yield or production, because during the post-harvest processes they were suffering poorness as they had wait for the buyers to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during the period.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the warehousing/storage of his maize products.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman and has been blessed with seven kids. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Kwekwe operates a poultry selling business. She mentioned disease outbreaks that cause losses as a challenge in the business. With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase poultry feeds for her chicks. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds for her chicks.

loans.name: Florence Mueni

texts.en:
Florence Mueni is a thirty-nine-year-old lady. She is married with five children. She operates a greengrocery business and has been in this business for five years now. She earns a monthly income of approximately six thousand shillings. 

This is her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy stock like cabbages, carrots, onions, etc. She plans to use the profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Ratnadeep Self Help Group-2

texts.en:
Khukumoni is 27 years old, living in a community in the Narendrapur village in West Bengal. She is married and has two daughters and a son; her daughters are in 7th and 3rd grade while her son is too young to go to school. She didn't have access to a formal education but that didn't stop her from learning to read and write.

Khukumoni and her husband do paddy (rice) cultivation and earn around INR 45,000 per year. She has always faced a lot of challenges to increase the yield. She is now asking for a loan that will allow her to improve the quantity and quality of her paddy cultivation. She will use the loan  to buy seeds, fertilizers and to pay labor costs.

Khukumoni’s happy and enthusiastic personality is something that really characterizes this entrepreneur, and it is reflected in the work that she does in her small farm. Her dream is that her farm would be considered a model of paddy cultivation with a good, high-quality yield for which she works day in and day out as she is sure that this line of work has great economic potential.

The other member of “Ratnadeep” Self-Help Group (SHG), Anjana is also requesting a loan to improve her paddy fields.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and to pay labor cost for paddy (rice) cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a widowed woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Rachael operates a vegetable-selling stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she will buy onions, vegetables and tomatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy onions, vegetables and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 46-year-old gentleman who is married to Pauline, and together they have five children aged between 24 and 2 years. He has been running a butcher shop for the last 15 years and making a monthly profit of about Kenya shillings 15,000.

He has applied for his fourth loan with Visionfund Kenya which he plans to use to purchase livestock for slaughter to add more meat in his butcher shop. He plans to use the anticipated income to expand his business and educate his children.

He hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for slaughter.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 33 years old. She is married with three children. This loan will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for maize products that are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will help the entire community to have secure storage of their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is significantly saving their yield or production, because during the post-harvest processes the farmers suffer poorness when they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day to day needs during the period.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/storage construction for maize products.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal operates a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. In addition, she sells food in her cafe and also sells charcoal to supplement her income.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase food consumables as well as cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase food consumables as well as cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 36 years old. He has requested a Kiva loan to pay for warehouse construction. This is a new loan product for UOB. This loan will help in the construction of a warehouse or storage area for the maize products that are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will help the entire community to have secure storage of their products in the future. 

UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is significantly protecting their yield or production, because during the post-harvest processes farmers suffer poorness as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day to day needs during the period.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/storage construction for maize products.

loans.name: Susan Naserian

texts.en:
Susan Naserian, aged 30, is married with two children. She has been farming at Oloitoktok for the past six years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.
 
This is her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and agri-chemicals. She will use the profits to educate her children. In the future, she plans to buy her own plot.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and agri-chemicals

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 41-year-old gentleman who is married and a father of three children. He has been in the carpentry business for the last 13 years and he makes a monthly profit of about Kenya shillings 17,000. 

He has applied for his third loan with Visionfund Kenya which he plans to use to add some items like nails, wood and a new wood plane for his business. he hopes to use the income to expand his business.

In the future he would like to own a transport vehicle and also to educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To add a stock of some items needed in his carpentry business.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with one child. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past one year, her potential customers mostly being ladies. In addition she also operates a food selling business which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase a hair drier machine for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a hair drier machine for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en:
Olivier is 33 years old. He has requested a Kiva loan through a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) to pay for warehouse construction. This loan will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during that period.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce

loans.name: Asllidin

texts.ru:
Аслиддин жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет 2-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Аслиддин живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он имеет среднее образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Аслиддин является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Аслиддин занимается своим любимым делом. Он повар, этому делу он научился, посещая курсы по приготовлению еды. Аслиддин имеет небольшое кафе, где  готовит салаты и национальную еду. Также Аслиддин  подрабатывает тем, что готовит самбусу для продажи.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Аслиддину в его деле, она она готовит тесто для самбусы.  Сейчас Аслиддин хочет получить кредит для развития своего бизнеса, а именно ему нужно закупить несколько мешков муки. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку муки. Аслиддин очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Asliddin is a cheerful and hardworking man of 30. He is married with two children. He turned to Arvand as soon as he found out there was a possibility of receiving financial support. Asliddin lives with his family in a rural area. He has a high school education as there was no possibility of his studying at university due to family financial difficulties. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of household chores and the children.

In order to earn a living, Asliddin works in his chosen field. He is a cook, a trade he learned by taking courses in food preparation. He has a small café where he prepares salads and national dishes. He also earns money by selling sambusas, a local food related to the Indian samosa. He brings in good money from this. His wife helps him with it by preparing the sambusa dough. Asliddin wants a loan to develop his business - specifically, he needs to buy a few bags of flour. Therefore he has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy flour. Asliddin very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy flour for his food business

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille is 30 years old. She has been farming for the past 12 years. This new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during that period.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce

loans.name: Cristóbal Silva

texts.es:
Cristóbal de 53 años, alista diario sus botas de hule, su pantalón y camisa vieja para cuidar de sus vacas. Desde hace 45 años, emprendió su negocio. Sin haber entrado a ningún colegio, destacó en el campo. Recordando que tan solo tenía 15 años cuando cortaba algodón, café o piña en Costa Rica.  Con el tiempo fue ahorrando, hasta que el agropecuario ahorro lo suficiente, compró sus primeras vacas y empezó a sembrar maíz. 
Cristóbal está casado y es padre de tres hijos de 30, 28 y 24 años, todos independientes. No tiene otros ingresos además de este, es por ello que necesita de un préstamo para comprar una vaquilla y un alambre para mejorar las cercas de potrero, para ubicar y mantener bien sus vacas. Entre sus metas está empezar la siembra de maíz postrera y su plan es conseguir luego otro préstamo para mejorar su finca.
texts.en:
On a daily basis, Cristóbal who is 53 years old, enlists his rubber boots, his pants and his old shirt to care for his cows.  Forty-five years ago, he started his business. Without having attended any school, he excelled in the field. He recalls that he was only 15 years old when chopped cotton, coffee or pineapple in Costa Rica. Over time, he saved enough agricultural income from farming/cattle, bought his first cows and began to plant corn.

Cristóbal is married and is the father of three children of aged 30, 28 and 24, all independent. He has no other sources of income besides these, which is why he needs a loan to buy a heifer and a wire to improve the paddock fences, and to locate and maintain his cows properly. Among his goals is to start the second harvest of corn and then his plan is to get another loan to improve his farm.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and wire to improve the fencing in his paddock.

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en:
Gaudance is 34 years old. She has requested a Kiva loan to pay for warehouse construction. This new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB)’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
Rodrigo un hombre que como muchos le debe todo su conocimiento y actividad económica a sus padres. Rodrigo es un hombre de 49 años de edad que se desempeña en la compra y venta de papas al por mayor, con la que ha podido mantener su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos dos de ellos superan la mayoría de edad. Solicita un crédito para la compra la papas para aumentar su distribución mensual, abarcando un mayor números de pedidos y poder cubrir un déficit que le genero el robo de bultos de su mercancía. 
Su principal sueño es tener un negocio más grande y solido lo que le traería múltiples beneficios como una mejor calidad de vida, un mayor capital para invertir en la educación de sus hijos, en su hogar e incluso en el mismo y sabe que este crédito es el primer paso para acercarse a este sueño
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a man who, like many, owes his profession and all of his knowledge to his parents. Rodrigo is a 49-year-old man who works buying and selling potatoes on a wholesale basis. With this work, he has been able to support his family, made up of his wife and three children, two of whom are already adults. He is requesting a loan to buy potatoes to increase his monthly distribution, cover a larger number of orders and compensate for a loss caused by the theft of some sacks of his merchandise. 

His main dream is to have a larger and more solid business which will bring him multiple benefits, such as a better quality of life and more capital to invest in his children's education, in his home and even in himself. He knows that this loan is the first step for him to come closer to his dream.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of potatoes to increase his sales and compensate for a recent loss through theft.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is aged 34. He has requested a Kiva loan to pay for warehouse construction. This is a new loan product for Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy overlock, coverstitch and lockstitch sewing machines and raw material to start her own dressmaking workshop.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 42 years old. This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. loans.use: To pay for warehouse construction for maize produce

loans.name: Sonia Yanira

texts.es:
Sonia continua con la venta de ropa para niños, jóvenes, adultos y lociones,  pues le ha ido bastante bien y esta mejorando su condición de vida. 

Sonia desea mantener su inventario para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, por lo que con este préstamo volvera a comprar 3 docenas de ropa para niño y  3 docenas de ropa para jóvenes entre ellos blusas,  faldas, pantalones y camisas.
texts.en:
Sonia continues to sell clothing for children, young people and adults, as well as lotions. It has gone very well for her and she is improving her living conditions. 

Sonia wishes to boost her stock so that she can offer her customers variety. She will use this loan to once more buy three dozen items of clothing for children and three dozen for young people, including blouses, skirts, trousers and shirts.

loans.use: to buy children's and young people's clothing by the dozen, including blouses, skirts, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens in order to increase his production.

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal una vez más recurre a un crédito kiva, para continuar surtiendo su negocio de venta de calzado femenino, ya que el crédito anterior le ha servido mucho y esta vez desea comprar  60 pares de calzado femenino.
Agradece a las personas que confian en él y en su negocio.
texts.en: Cristóbal is once more seeking a Kiva loan, in order to stock his business selling women's shoes. His previous loan helped him a lot, and this time he wishes to buy 60 pairs of women's shoes. He is grateful to the people who trust in him and his business.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of women's shoes.

loans.name: Marinela Ines

texts.es:
La señora marinela tiene 40 años y es una guerrera en la vida.
Hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la venta distintos tipos de mercancía como ropa, bolsos, zapatos y accesorios, elementos que la han llevado a esforzarse día a día para alcanzar sus metas.
Hace un tiempo tuvo unos fuertes problemas familiares que afectaron su economía, desde este momento su negocio entro en crisis y la obligo a suspenderlo.
Hoy en día desea volver a retomarlo y ha invertido algunos ahorros en este fin pero de todos modos necesita un impulso más grande para conseguir más mercancía y aumentar su inventario, de esta manera podrá asegurar unas ventas más estables y levantara de nuevo su actividad de entre las cenizas.
texts.en: Marinela is 40 years old and a fighter in life. For approximately 8 years, she has sold various types of merchandise like clothes, bags, shoes, and accessories, which has empowered her to achieve her day-to-day goals. Awhile ago, she had some big family problems which affected her finances. From this moment, her business was in crisis and she was forced to close it. Now, she hopes to reopen it and has invested some of her savings in it but she needs a big investment anyways in order to buy more merchandise and increase her inventory. By doing this, she will be able to ensure more stable sales to lift her business from the ashes.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of clothes, shoes, and accessories to sell and to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.ru:
Неъматулло жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый парень в возрасте 23 лет. Он женат и пока не имеет детей. Неъматулло живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Неъматулло также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой. Он очень любит свою жену и родителей и старается всегда помогать им чем может.

Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на проживание, Неъматулло занимается своим бизнесом. У него имеется небольшой магазин, где он продает продукты питания и разные напитки. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Неъматулло в его деле, она убирается и наводит порядок в магазине своего мужа.  Сейчас Неъматулло хочет расширить ассортимент продуктов для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку продуктов. Неъматулло очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nematullo is a cheerful and hardworking man of 23. He is married with no children and lives with his family in a rural area. He doesn't have a higher education, since he didn't have the opportunity to study at university due to family financial difficulties. His wife doesn't have an education either and stays at home. Nematullo loves his wife and parents very much and always tries to help them with anything they need.

In order to earn a living, Nematullo runs a business, a small store where he sells food products and various drinks. He receives a good income from this occupation. His wife also helps him by cleaning and organizing her husband's shop. Nematullo wants to expand his assortment of goods to grow his business. Therefore he has turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase inventory. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Bibiana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Bibiana es una mujer de 35 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos la cual desempeña una labor en el pueblo para alimentar sus hijos, pues su esposo por motivos de la vida ya no está en este mundo hace aproximadamente 12 años, Bibiana quiere iniciar su propio negocio de venta de leche actividad que aprendió de su difunto esposo y la quiere realizar junto con un amigo mayordomo quien tiene una vaca y juntos atenderían y acogerían más clientes como estrategia de mercadeo.
Bibiana hace poco retomo sus tierras las cuales fueron arrebatadas por grupos armados y hace poco le fueron devueltas, quiere crecer como empresaria realizando al actividad con la que su esposo la mantuvo tanto tiempo en honor a su memoria, este crédito será el inicio de un nuevo ciclo de vida para Bibiana, que lo único que quiere es poder vivir tranquilamente con sus tres hijos
texts.en:
Bibiana, age 35, has three children.  She works in the town in order to feed her children.  Her husband lost his life, and has not been in this world for approximately 12 years.

Bibiana wants to start her own business of selling milk.  She learned this business activity from her deceased husband.  She wants to do this with a friend who has a position of respect and responsibility.  He has a cow, and together they could tend to and receive more customers as a marketing strategy.

A little while ago Bibiana took back the land that was snatched away by armed groups.  A little while ago the land was returned.  She wants to grow as a businesswoman by engaging in this business activity that her husband maintained for such a long time to honor his memory.

This loan will be the start of a new cycle in Bibiana’s life.  The only thing that she wants is to be able to live peacefully with her three children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle (sheep and goats) in order to raise and resell them.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru:
Диловар жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 31 года. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Диловар живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Диловара также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием ребенка.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Диловар занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается купле продажей минеральных напитков и продуктов питания. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Сейчас Диловар хочет приобрести мебель для  своего дома, так как в его доме не имеется удобств для проживания. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Диловар очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilovar is a cheerful and hardworking man of 31. He is married and has one child. He turned to Arvand as soon as he found out that there was the possibility of financial support. Dilovar lives with his family in a rural area. He doesn't have a higher education, as he was unable to study at university due to family financial difficulties. His wife doesn't have an education either and is a homemaker, taking care of household duties and child-rearing.

In order to earn a living, Dilovar has a business buying and selling soft drinks and food products. He receives a good income from this occupation. He wants to buy furniture for his home, since it is currently not fully furnished. Therefore he has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy furniture. He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home

loans.name: Kaja-B Group

texts.en:
Meshack is a hard working man who was born in the 1980s. He is single and makes his living by managing three various enterprises. He has been managing a stationery shop, a barber shop and a photo studio for four years now. Together with his helpers, he works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Meshack is a good client of Tujijenge; he always pays on time. This is his 16th loan request through Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open a barber shop, introduced a new branch of the stationery shop and restocked his businesses inventory. He earned a profit which he used to cover his welfare expenses and plow back into his businesses. Meshack will use this loan to open another new stationery business. He believes that one day his businesses will grow to company level.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kaja-B" which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another new stationery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for soil treatment such as fertilizers and pesticides, among others

loans.name: Oscar Osmin

texts.es: Oscar tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de de 6 años, 4 años y un año de edad. ÉL es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica  a la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace 13 años. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y para pagar la mano de obra necesaria para la construcción.
texts.en: Oscar is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and 3 children who are 6, 4 and 1 year old.  He is a hard working man who has made a living through the provision of security services for the past 13 years.  In this way, he was earned a living and provides for the livelihood of his home.  In order to better their living conditions, he has made the decision to request this loan through FUISA to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand and iron and to pay for the labor needed for construction.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, iron and labor to build a bedroom

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru:
Парвиз жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 32 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Парвиз живёт со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Он с юных лет работает вместе со своим отцом на поле, учился пасти скот. С тех пор он многому научился и сейчас сам занимается таким же делом.

Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание, Парвиз занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Парвизу в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Парвиз хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Парвиз очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Parviz, age 32, is a hardworking man with a positive attitude in life.  He is married and the father of three children.  He lives with his family in a very small village.  Since his childhood, Parviz has been helping his father with the farm work and cattle raising.  He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is now involved in the same activities.

Parviz now has his own business, which provides a stable income and allows him to feed his family.  He is involved in raising and reselling cattle, an activity from which he derives a decent income.  His wife also helps him with the business, as she sells the milk they get from their cows.  Parviz is currently trying to increase his number of farm animals in order to expand his business.  For this reason, he has turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to buy more cattle.  Parviz is really looking forward to a positive outcome and he thanks Arvand his advance for all their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Fancois is 42 years old. He is married with three children. This is a new loan product for UOB. This loan will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize production while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This infrastructure will help the entire community to have a secure storage site for their crops in the future. UOB’s farmers clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is increasing significantly their yield or production. However, during the post-harvest process many are suffering financially as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge to solve their primary day to day needs during the period.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the warehouse construction for maize production

loans.name: Esmelda Beatriz

texts.es:
Esmelda es una señora de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos que aún están a su cargo. Desde hace dos años comenzó su propio negocio, en el cual comercializa diferentes productos para la satisfacción alimentación de la familia. Gracias a un primer préstamo financiado por KIVA_MICREDITO logro comprar productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos de limpieza, fosforo, productos enlatados
entre otro productos, también productos uso personales como prendas de plata 925 y cosméticos. Actualmente ella desea realizar nuevamente otro préstamo para la compra de zapatos, sombrillas, prendas de plata 925, cosméticos, capotes para cubrirse la lluvia entre otros producto. Estimando que el préstamo le será de gran ayuda ya que lograra crecer su negocio, sostener a su familia y obtener mayores ganancias. Su siguiente paso es ampliar mas su negocio para lograr llegar a ser una gran distribuidora de productos basicos, uso personal y de aseo.
texts.en:
Esmerelda is a woman of 41 years who is married and the mother of three children still under her care.  It has been two years since she began her own business, in which she sells different products for pleasure and the feeding of the family.  Thanks to the first loan through KIVA_MICREDITO she managed to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, cleaning supplies, matches, and canned goods, as well as personal use items such as 92.5% silver jewelry and cosmetics.  Actually, she wants to again request another loan to buy shoes, hats, 92.5% silver jewelry, cosmetics and rain cloaks, among other products.

She hopes that this loan will be of great help to her so that she will be able to grow her business, support her family and increase her profits.  Her next step is to expand her business in order to become an important distributor of basic goods, personal use items and toiletries.

loans.use: to by shoes, hats, 92.5% silver jewelry, cosmetics, and rain cloaks among other products

loans.name: Elizabeth Carolina

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth tiene 22 años, casada tiene dos hijos pequeños de cuatro y tres añitos, el se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas desde hace mucho tiempo, vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la localidad de el Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La señora Elizabeth va a usar este préstamo para la compra de conservadora para conservar sus alimentos siempre frescos, y también insumos para la elaboración de hamburguesas,  La señora Elizabeth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona  hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida rapida ya que es una zona comercial, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimas hamburguesas,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en permitirle hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is 22 years old, married, and has two small children (ages 4 and 3). She has been preparing and selling hamburgers and “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes) for a long time. Elizabeth sells from a stand that is located in her hometown, which is the city of El Torno.

This loan is her first transaction with Emprender. Sra. Elizabeth will use the funds to buy a cooler so that her food is always kept fresh, especially the ingredients for making hamburgers. She faces challenges in her business, such as the competition in the area since there are many eateries that sell fast food within the commercial district. Elizabeth will use her profits to continue buying supplies for preparing her delicious hamburgers.

She is pleased and appreciative of this opportunity given to her so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Idalia Yamileth

texts.es: Idalia tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Idalia se gana la vida mediante la venta de fruta picada de forma ambulante. La venta la realiza desde hace 5 años y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Idalia desea construir un cuarto dormitorio a base de lámina por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la construcción como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Idalia is 29 years old and resides in her own home along with her two-year-old son. She earns her living by selling sliced fruit as a street vendor. Idalia has been doing this type of work for five years and it has enabled her to sustain her household.

She wants to build a bedroom made of metal sheets, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. Idalia will invest in the purchase of the necessary construction materials such as galvanized sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a bedroom.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:

This constructed infrastructure will help the entire community by providing a secure store of their crops in the future.
