loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in order to produce more food for sale

loans.name: Kotognogontala  A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA  A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz  avec madame ABI débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA  A. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide de marque différente et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  140 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala A group are married women who on average are 38 years old with three children. Most live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in the municipality of Kaboila, part of the Sikasso circle in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the  Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loan has been fully repaid.

The selected crop is rice featuring Mrs. ABI, standing in the middle of the picture in this Kotognogontala A group of women. She will use her loan to buy four 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, four cans of different brands of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one hectare (about 2.5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 140,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, agricultural inputs and pay for tilling

loans.name: El Progreso Del Vallecito Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL PROGRESO DEL VALLECITO” se encuentra conformada por socios jóvenes empeñosos en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Amith tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos educando. El se dedica a la venta de verduras en horas de la mañana juntamente con su esposa. En horas de la tarde se dedica a prestar servicios de mototaxista. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras de toda variedad para ampliar su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Amith es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The group “El Progreso del Vallecito” consists of enterprising young people who want to improve the quality of life for their families.

Amith is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children who are in school. He sells vegetables in the mornings with his wife. In the afternoons, he provides motorcycle taxi services. His loan will be invested in vegetables of all varieties so that he can expand his business.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that has been issued. Amith is the second person standing on the right side.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es: Omaira una mujer muy casera de 48 años de edad la cual como prioridad tiene a su hijo por el cual ha luchado contra vientos y mareas para su sostenimiento puesto que actualmente está separada de su esposo y la situación se tornó en un inicio muy complicada. Para el sostenimiento de su familia ideo una manera de vender muy particular y es la venta de refrescos y cervezas desde su hogar, permitiéndose compartir con sus clientes el calor humano de su familia y el ambiente rumbero que caracteriza tanto a las personas de este sector lo cual para ella ha sido un gran éxito y hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultad pues sus objetos personales están muy separados de donde distribuye y atiende a sus clientes. Solicita un crédito para la compra de cervezas y refrescos con los que espera seguir creciendo y brindándole a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Omaira is a 48-year-old housewife who makes her son a priority. She has been fighting an uphill battle to support him since she is currently separated from her husband. This situation has been very complicated from the beginning. In order to provide for her family, Omaira came up with a way to sell a very specific product, soft drinks and beer, from her home. This allows her to share the warmth of her family with her customers and the rhythmic environment that is known among the people who live in this area.

Her business has been a great success so far since it has not presented any difficulties for her. The personal challenges she must deal with include being located a long distance from her distributors and attending to her customers. Omaira is requesting a loan in order to buy beer and soft drinks. She hopes to continue growing so that she can provide a better quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  C Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA  C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec madame AMINATA OUMAR débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA  C. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala C group are married women who on average are 31 years old with two children. Most live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in the municipality of Kaboila, part of the Sikasso circle in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loan has been fully repaid.

The selected crop is rice featuring Mrs. Aminata Oumar, standing in the second position from right to left in the picture of this Kotognogontala C group of women.

She will use her loan to buy seeds, one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one fourth of an hectare (about 0.6 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, agricultural seeds and pay for tilling

loans.name: Rosenee

texts.en: Rosenee lives in the Port-Salut area with her relatives. She is well known mostly in her church since she is a deaconess and a worship leader there. In the past, she used to work with her parents in agriculture, but now she is very excited to become an Enèji Pwòp retailer. She will be selling Ti Powa lanterns. A loan will enable her to get started in the new business. She attends a church that has about 100 members, who are mainly her target market.

loans.use: To purchase Ti Powa Lanterns to sell

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Doña Alba, tiene 69 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo y un nieto en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Tiene su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace 10 años, vende ropa, fajas, carteras y zapatos. Este negocio lo tiene en un local del mercado. Ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, calcetas, short y zapatos para vender y generar ingresos. Ella tiene planes de seguir creciendo como comerciante, y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Alba is 69 years old and has two children. She lives with her husband and a grandson in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.

Alba has been earning her own income for the past 10 years by selling clothes, belts, wallets, and shoes. Her business is situated in a space at the market. Alba has maintained a stable business by investing several loans. She is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL. Alba will use the money to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, socks, shorts, and shoes to sell so that she can generate income.

She plans to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, socks, shorts, and shoes.

loans.name: Charmant

texts.en: Charmant is feeling very happy with his first loan by selling Eneji Pwop products to the fishermen that he has been leading for a few years. They have been using the stoves and solar lanterns to cook and light by night when they are fishing. So he has sold all of his first stock, repaid the loan and now he is coming to take his second loan.

loans.use: to buy stoves and lanterns for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Asmatara

texts.en:
Asmatara is 30 years old. She is from Kothapara, which is in a remote region in the Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Aftar, 38 years old.  Both are illiterate and can sign only their names. Together they are raising two children (one son and one daughter), who are in different grades of secondary school and live at home.

Asmatara's husband is a farmer. Asmatara is a very hardworking woman who pursues the domestic duties in her home and helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Along with her partner, she grows potatoes, beans, bottle gourds, chilies, etc. This is an activity they developed many years ago and, which she learned along with him. The land they cultivate together is their own, acquired with much effort and sacrifice.

Like other cultivators, her plans for the future are to expand her land and grow other vegetables, which will allow her to grow with her business and with her family. She wants to cultivate bitter gourd, which is an all-season crop in much demand among the local people.

She is applying for financing from BJS to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. to start cultivation as early as possible. She hopes she will get an excellent result from this. She wants to use her income to support her children in their studies, since that is the best inheritance that she can offer to each of them.

She also aspires to purchase a tractor in the future with the profit from her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize inputs to increase the production capacity at his maize flour company.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa lives in the small village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.  She is married and a housewife. She is only 30 years old and illiterate, deprived of an education due her parents' poor economic condition.  She can only sign her name. Her husband Aminun, 40 years old, is a farmer by profession.  They are raising three children (two sons and one daughter) who are in different grades in the village school.

Latifa's husband has an agricultural farm where he grows vegetables, mainly potatoes, which is a staple vegetable in their region. He is visionary and focused. He has good experience in this field, as he has been doing this for the last 10 years.  He struggles hard to grow quality vegetables.  His land is fertile and productive. Latifa, though a housewife, helps a lot in his work, especially at the time of harvesting and carrying the products to the local markets. Now they want to cultivate ribbed gourd on their farmland.

Latifa has asked for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation. She has chosen this crop, as it is the best season to cultivate this crop and there is a high demand for this crop in their locality.

Her goals are to strengthen their family business and economy and to provide a better education for her children.

She thanks her lenders for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating ribbed gourd.

loans.name: Nadiegueton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADIEGUETON 1 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Brehima  en position assise sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Nadiegueton 1 group are married men who on average are 49 years old with three children. All  live in traditional families in Flazambougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

The selected crop is maize featuring Brehima, who is sitting in the picture. He will use his loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one and a half hectares (about 3.7 acres).

The crop is sold after harvest at village level in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele essentially composed of resellers from large cities.

He expects to make an average profit of 200,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable him to pay off his loan, and also help the extended family with daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Abibatu. She is single and has one child aged nine years old. Abibatu owns a wax cotton fabrics business. She began her business because she dropped out of school after senior secondary school exams.  Her father died and she could not get any financial support from family members. She had no alternative but to join her mother's business. Several years later she started her own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,256,000 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy one bail of wax cotton. In the future, Abibatu plans to order to face the competition challenge in the market. She needs a large sum of capital and the loan will be a great help in achieving her business goal. She is hardworking and committed to her business. Having a business has made her have financial security and in order to maintain the business she needs a little help. She thanks ARD for rendering such a service. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of wax cotton

loans.name: Roosevelt

texts.en: Roosevelt is living in the Port-Salut area. He is married and both he and his wife are teachers in the secondary school in their locality. They have four children, three of whom are at school. He is also a church leader. The church has about 150 members. So he has an opportunity to open a good market with them. Now he is coming to us to take out his first loan to purchase solar lanterns and stoves from Eneji Pwop to resell in his locality.

loans.use: To purchase solar lanterns and stoves

loans.name: Norma Marisol

texts.es: Norma tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa de su madre junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 5 años, 7 años y 14 años de edad. Norma se dedica a la venta de huevos al por mayor desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora quien siempre esta pendiente de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Norma solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor y para construir un baño para lo cual necesita materiales como: polines, ladrillos, hierro, cemento, arena, lamina y pago de mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: Norma is 33 years old and lives in her mother's house, together with her life partner and their three children, who are 5, 7, and 14 years old. For a long time, Norma has earned her living selling eggs wholesale. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who is always looking to give her family better living conditions. She is requesting this loan via FUSAI in order invest it in building a hallway and bathroom for her home, for which she needs materials such as planks, bricks, reinforcing steel, cement, sand, metal sheeting, and labour costs to pay for the construction.

loans.use: to buy planks, bricks, reinforcing steel, cement, sand, metal sheeting, and labour to build a hallway and bathroom for her home.

loans.name: Princevelle

texts.en: Princevelle is 23 years of age, presently residing in Gango, Ozamis City. She is married with two children. Princevelle has an existing business which is a mini store located in her own house. She requested a loan for additional capital for her store. She used her loan to purchase additional inventories of rice, canned goods, and noodles to sell along with many more things. She had this business for about two years and she hopes that she can improve and expand her business and also save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories of rice, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 36 years old, married, and a resident of Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living through farming and hog raising.

She has been a member of PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative) for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy cement, metal, nails, and wood and to pay for labor to finish building her house.

Norma deeply wishes to maintain good standing as a member of PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for labor to repair her house and to buy nails, wood, metal, cement, etc.

loans.name: Genoviva

texts.en:
Genoviva is divorced with three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Genoviva sells goods and dry goods to earn a living and she has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for additional capital to buy goods and dry goods for her store.

Genoviva has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to renovate her store into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy goods and dry goods for her store

loans.name: Nadiegueton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADIEGUETON 4 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec  Oudou debout en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la  droite sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Nadiegueton 4 group are married men who, on average, are 45 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Flazambougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

Oudou, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to farm one and a half hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to customers who are mostly resellers coming from the large towns.

Oudou hopes to earn and average profit of 225,000 francs CFA per harvest. 

Earnings will allow him to pay back his loan and also help his large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Ascensión De María

texts.es: Ascensión tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer comprometida con su familia quien busca todas las oportunidades para darles mejores condiciones de vida. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual necesita materiales como hierro, ladrillo, cemento, arena, polines, lámina etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ascensión is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. She is a woman committed to her family, who looks for every opportunity to give them better living conditions.

With the desire to improve their housing conditions, she is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the building of a bedroom, for which she needs materials such as steel, bricks, cement, sand, roofing beams, sheet metal, etc. 

She hopes to be able to count on this funding and make a start on the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy steel, bricks, cement, sand, roofing beams, sheet metal, etc., to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Yeni Paola

texts.es: Yeni, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. En busca de obtener ingresos estuvo prestando el servicio de lavado de ropa y hace un año decidió poner una pulpería donde vende refrescos, churros, arroz, azúcar, embutidos, gelatina, manteca, frijoles etc. su conyugue tiene un negocio de llantera donde ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,500 lempiras para comprar embutidos, leche, azúcar y frijoles y lograr aumentar las ventas. Su idea es ampliar el negocio, surtirlo y darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yeni, 21 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has two children. She lives in a small village which is part of the Macuelizo municipality, Santa Barbara.

In search of getting a better income, she was offering a laundry service, and a year ago she decided to open a grocery where she sells drinks, churros, rice, sugar, sausages, jelly, butter, beans, etc. Her partner has a tire shop where he helps with the family expenses.

The loan she is requesting is for 5,500 lempiras to buy sausages, milk, sugar, beans and increase her sales. Her idea is to expand the business, stock it and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy sausages, milk, sugar, beans and increase her sales.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Doña Lucila, tiene  68  años de edad, esta soltera,vive con una hija en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace varios años  que estableció una pulpería donde vende refrescos, churros, granos básicos, dulces, pan, lácteos, útiles escolares, achinería, abarrotes,etc. Al negocio le ha invertido tres prestamos anteriores, actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo que es  por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar  más productos para la pulpería con el propósito de aumentar las ganancias, comprara refrescos, churros, granos básicos y productos de abarrotería. Su plan es mantenerlo siempre surtido el negocio ya que es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Lucila, 68, is single living with her daughter in Puerto Cortes. She’s always worked in commerce. Several years ago she opened a grocery store where she sells soft-drinks, packaged snacks, basic grains, candy, bread, dairy products, school supplies, low-cost novelty items, groceries, etc. She’s invested three previous loans into the business. She’s currently asking for this fourth cycle a loan of 11,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy more goods for the grocery store aiming at increasing her profits. She will buy soft-drinks, packaged snacks, basic grains and groceries. Her plan is to keep it well-stocked because this is her source of income.

loans.use: To buy food products to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Albertina

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con una hija y su yerno en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Lleva 3 años de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, vende variedad de ropa como ser pantalones, short, blusas, camisas, camisetas, faldas, ropa interior etc. La mercadería la vende de forma ambulante y por pedidos. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar y surtir de ropa nueva para la venta y aumentar el numero de clientes. Su sueño es tener un local para establecer el negocio.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old. She is a single mother and lives with one of her daughters and her son-in-law in the town of Puerto Cortes.

For the past three years, she has had her own source of income: selling a variety of clothes such as trousers, shorts, blouses, shirts, skirts, underwear etc. She makes her sales as a street vendor and through taking orders.

She has decided to apply for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras in order to buy and stock new clothing for sale and increase her number of customers. Her dream is to have premises from which to run the business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to stock the business

loans.name: Nadiegueton 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADIEGUETON 6 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.

Abdoul Karim, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows corn. With this loan, he plans to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to farm one and a half hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to customers who are mostly resellers coming from the large towns.

Abdoul Karim hopes to earn an average profit of 265,000 francs CFA per harvest.

Earnings will allow him to pay back his loan and also help his large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Nadiegueton A Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADIEGUETON A sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec  Nouhou debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 500.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Nadiegueton A group are married men who, on average, are 45 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Flazambougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

Nouhou, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to farm three hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and at markets in Sikasso to customers who are mostly resellers coming from the large towns.

Nouhou hopes to earn an average profit of 500,000 francs CFA per harvest.

Earnings will allow him to pay back his loan and also help his large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Lyn Jonathan

texts.es:
Lyn Jonathan tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte en mototaxi, desde hace más de 5 años, en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi como aceites, neumáticos entre otros y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Lyn Jonathan is 28 years old, he lives together with his wife and children in a big community in the urban zone of Cayalti where its population makes a living through agriculture, trade and cattle-raising. Located in Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru. 

He has been providing transport services on motorcycle taxi for over 5 years, from his own home. He has asked for a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi such as oil and tires etc, and in this way continue offering a better service.

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi such as oil and tires.

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es:
María Aurelia tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos como (arroz, fideos, papas) y de esta manera ofrecer otros platos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Aurelia, 59, is a widow and she lives with a daughter in the district of Cayaltí, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock farming located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has a food business set up in her home where she attends to loyal customers.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme to buy supplies such as rice, noodles and potatoes so she can offer her clients different dishes.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, noodles and potatoes so she can offer otherdifferent dishes to clients.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, siendo los sembríos principales banano, maíz, limón, frejol caupí comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza nuestro cliente es el servicio de mototaxi, producción y comercio de limón desde hace 5 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de limón y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Felix, 43, is single and lives in his own house in the district of La Matanza, a peaceful community whose local people work in agriculture.  Their main crops are banana, corn, lemon, and beans.  They also work in commerce and livestock farming.  The area is in the province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura Region on the northern coast of Peru.

The borrower runs a motortaxi business and has been producing and selling lemons for five years.  He has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme to buy fertilizers for maintenance of his lemon crop so he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for maintenance of his lemon crop.

loans.name: Homero

texts.es:
Homero tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto a su esposa y 02 hijos en el Centro Poblado Sector El Campo, una zona rural del Distrito Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza el cliente es la compra y venta de ganado vacuno desde hace 12 años en la Plaza de Ganado del Centro Poblado de San Juan De Chiple, lugar donde se reúnen caseríos aledaños que realizan este tipo de actividad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Homero is 38 years old and lives in his own house made out of rustic materials with his wife and 02 children in the Centro Poblado Sector El Campo, a rural area of the District of Callayuc. The population in this area dedicates itself to agriculture, commerce and livestock and it is located in the Province of Cutervo which is part of the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has been buying and selling cattle for the last 12 years at the cattle market in the San Juan De Chiple town centre, where people from neighbouring villages also gather to do the same. He has asked for a loan of 2,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced food to fatten up his cattle and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: buy balanced food to fatten up his cattle

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es: Francisco José tiene 38 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene una hija de 5 meses de edad, se dedica a cultivar papa  en las cercanías de su casa y es una actividad que le deja buena ganancia, de esta actividad obtiene sus ingresos y de un taxi rotativo, Francisco José solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 5,000.00 para comprar insumos (semilla de papa, abono orgánico, fertilizante entre otros)  para el cultivo de papa, Francisco José tiene planeado terminar de construir unos locales para darlos en alquiler y con ello mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Jose, 38, lives in the town and department of Sololá.  He has a five-month old daughter and he grows potatoes for a living near his home.  He earns a good profit through his work and also earns income from his taxi business.

Francisco Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 GTQ to buy supplies such as potato seeds, organic compost, fertilizer and other items for his potato crop.  He plans to finish building some locales he has to rent them out to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his potato crop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children.

Rebecca has a store that sells goods and dry goods. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for additional capital to restock her store with basic commodities.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Maluay  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Maluay está formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres que con su trabajo buscan mejorar su economía para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, trabajan en el campo criando animales y también sembrando en los campos y su producción es mas para abastecer a su hogar, viven en la comunidad de Maluay en Cuenca que es una comunidad llena de vegetación y con unos paisajes encantadores.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 18 y 11 años, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en la escuela, su esposo es profesional en telefonía y ejerce su profesión en un taller de su propiedad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
La Señora María es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a laborar en el campo, se dedica a la agricultura orgánica, todos sus productos son sembrados sin ninguna clase de químicos, en esta actividad se encuentra 3 años, también cría animales como cuyes, cerdos y pollos, en sus tiempo libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de abono y semillas. Su meta es tener una finca integral de hortalizas.
texts.en:
The Maluay communal bank is comprised of ten women members who strive to improve their economies to give their children a better future.  They work raising animals and also growing crops for home consumption.  They live in the Maluay Community in Cuenca which is a community with lush vegetation and enchanting scenery.

One of the members of the group is Maria, who is 37 years old.  She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 11.  The eldest daughter is in high school and the youngest son in elementary.  Her husband works in telephone communication and has his own workshop.  They live in their own house.

Maria is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to organic agriculture.  None of her crops are grown with any type of chemicals.  She has been in business for three years.  She also raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  In her free time she sells cosmetics.  The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of compost and seeds.  Her goal is to have an integral vegetable crop farm.

loans.use: To buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Las Cuencanitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Cuencanitas está formado por un socio y seis socias luchadoras, alegres y trabajadoras quienes se esfuerzan día a día en sus trabajos para sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida y admirada por muchos debido a la belleza colonial de su centro histórico, su gente es cálida y muy amable, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nancy, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 13 y 11 años, sus dos primeros hijos  estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero y aporta  económicamente al hogar, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a realizar artesanías, hace adornos para el hogar, ella cuenta con un titulo artesanal certificado.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pinturas y cerámicas para la creación de sus artesanías. Su meta es tener un almacén para exhibir y vender sus creaciones.
texts.en:
The Las Cuencanitas group is made up of one male and six female members who are all fighters, happy and hard working people who every day strive to help their families get ahead. They live in the city of Cuenca, which is well known and admired by many for the colonial beauty of its historical centre and its warm and friendly people who maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of the group is Ms. Nancy who is 39 years old, married and has 3 children from her union aged 14, 13 and 11. Her oldest children go to high school and her youngest child goes to the little school in her city. Her husband is currently abroad and supports them financially; they own the house they live in.

Ms. Nancy dedicates herself to her household chores and to making crafts to decorate the home, in fact she is a certified crafter. She will invest the money from this loan in buying paints and ceramics to make her crafts with. Her goal is to have a store where she can display and sell her creations.

loans.use: buy paints and ceramics to make her crafts with

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una socia fundadora del grupo del crédito Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha emigrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias. 
La Señora María tiene 66 años de edad, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña María tiene una tienda de víveres desde hace 40 años, se dedica a la crianza de animales como ganado, cuyes y pollos,  también a la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de víveres para su tienda. Su meta es continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a founding member of the Nueva Amistad communal bank. She lives in the parish of Cumbe en Cuenca. Her family work in farming and cattle-raising. Much of the population have emigrated to various places around the word in search of a better quality of life for their families.

Maria is 66 years old, widowed but in her marriage she had 5 children who are adults now, married and living independently. She lives in her own home.

Maria has had a grocery store for 40 years, she works raising animals such as cattle, guinea pigs and chickens, which are also for the family consumption. 

The loan money is to buy provisions of food for her store. Her goal is to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy food provisions.

loans.name: María Eloisa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia desde hace 16 años del grupo de crédito Nuevas Amigas, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca donde su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha emigrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.
La Señora María tiene 73 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo quien vive en su casa, es casado y comparte los gastos de su hogar, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y conejos, también a la agricultura es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un excedente es para la venta. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas y alimento para animales. Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the Nuevas Amigas communal bank for 16 years. She lives in the Cumbe en Cuenca parish where her family work in agriculture and cattle-raising. Many people from her town have emigrated to various parts of the world, looking for a better quality of life for their families.

Maria is 73 years old, widowed and she has a son who lives with her, he is married and shares the household expenses, the house she lives in is her own.

Maria works raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and rabbits. The produce is for the family's consumption, and if there is any surplus it is sold. The money from the loan is to invest in buying guinea pigs, hens and animal feed. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens and animal feed.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive e4n la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 44 años de edad y trabaja como asistente de mantenimiento de hardware y software en una institución de su ciudad, desde hace 5 años, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque es padre de familia.

Carlos esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá reparar su moto, con la cual puede transportarse, de esta manera ya no gastará mucho dinero para movilizarse y de esta manera poder ahorrar; así el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the city of Pucallpa, is 44 years old and has worked as an assistant maintaining hardware and software for an institution in his city for the last 5 years. With this job he has the income he needs to get ahead, especially as he is a father.

Carlos is grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to their help he will be able to fix his motorbike which he can use for transport and in this way he'll be able to stop spending so much money to get around and will be able to start saving. He will keep working hard and striving to make his great dream a reality: "To have his own business".

loans.use: fix his motorcycle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with five children. Susan is 39 years old and lives in Balintawak, Aurora, ZDS.
Susan has a flower gardening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for her flower gardening activities.
Susan has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Susan hopes to earn more from her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for her flower gardening activities

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас жительница района Хамадони. Ей 36 лет. Она домохозяйка и нигде не работает. У Мукаддас двое детей - сын и дочь школьного возраста. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Мукаддас сейчас собирается начать деятельность, чтобы обеспечить себя работой, а семью источником дохода. Она планирует заняться растениеводством. Для этой цели Мукаддас просит кредит, чтобы купить семена и минеральные удобрения. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Mukaddas, age 36, is a resident of the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  She is a homemaker and is not employed.  She has two school-aged children, a son and a daughter.  Her husband is currently working in Russia.  Mukaddas is planning to start her own business, which will allow her to support herself and to provide a source of income for her family.  She wants to get involved in agriculture.  For this reason, Mukaddas is requesting a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to start her own farming business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a 53-year-old resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines and she is married to Gerardo. She and her husband, who is also a family driver, manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Isabel maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Isabel dreams of having her own house and lot and hopes that her children will finish their studies through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Joyce is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Joyce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear products mostly ladies' wear needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear products mostly ladies' wear.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Emelia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with two children.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Melanie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been with NWTF since 2007. She is now requesting a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Arlita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Arlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is widow and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and a dressmaking businesses. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 36 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Aurora works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Aurora has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Aurora has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Aurora is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old and has five children. Catherine is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Catherine and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Catherine is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Catherine has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Catherine can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with four children. Regina is forty-three years old and lives in Balintawak, Aurora, ZDS.

Regina is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for eighteen years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Regina hopes to build a flower shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for her flower garden.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with seven children. Alicia is 64 years old and lives in Balintawak, Aurora, ZDS. 

Alicia is a farmer and grows palay (rice) to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for agricultural farming.

Alicia has  been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Alicia hopes that she can harvest more sacks of rice.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for agricultural farming.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Ladymyres

texts.en:
Ladymyres is presently residing in Tinago, Ozamis City. She is  36 years old, married and has one child of school age. Ladymyres runs a grinding service at the public market. She caters for grinding of beans, coconuts, meat and vegetables. 

Recently, she has requested a loan to purchase whole nuts to sell. She had this business for about five years. Ladymyres will use her profit to expand her business and she also saves for the studies of her child.

loans.use: to purchase whole nuts to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and as she has been with NWTF since 2012 she is now requesting a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Rosalina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marmoliñia

texts.en:
Marmoliñia is 60 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations and has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her six children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Marmoliñia wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 46 years old and has three children. Amparo is married and has three children who are in school.

Amparo and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Amparo is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Amparo has been an NWTF borrower since 2011 and plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Amparo can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anecita is 53 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Anecita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Anecita is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Anecita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vilma Fe

texts.en:
Vilma Fe works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and as she has been with NWTF since 2013 she is now requesting a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Vilma Fe will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Vilma Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 48 years old and has five children. Alfreda is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Alfreda is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Alfreda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alfreda has been involved in pig-fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mercedita is 31 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Mercedita has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, cream, etc. for her ice cream production business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, cream for her ice cream production business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Amalia has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Amalia has taken a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Amalia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.es:
Silvano vive en la ciudad de Nazca, e sun hombre muy amigable y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja con mucho esmero como agricultor, actualmente tiene ha sembrado tuna, la cual se encuentra en etapa de infestación, asimismo también cultiva productos como cebolla, tuna, papa y ajo, de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que este oficio es su única fuente de ingresos.

Silvano esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda, podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, solventar los gastos de regadío, entre toros; lo que le permitirá tener una buena cosecha y seguir trabajando y luchando para poder sacara adelante a sus hijos  y hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una terreno propio para sembrar y mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Silvano lives in the city of Nazca and is a very friendly man and, above all, has a great desire to get ahead. For this, he works with great care as a farmer. At the moment he plants prickly pear cactus, which is currently in a stage of infestation. Additionally, he also grows crops such as onion, prickly pear cactus, potato and garlic. In this way he can have income to be able to help his family get ahead, since this job is his only source of income. 

Silvano is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering him since, thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase manure, fertilizer, pay the costs of irrigation, among others, which will permit him to have a good harvest and continue working and fighting to be able to help his children get ahead and realize his great dream: to have his own land to plant and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and irrigation costs, among others.

loans.name: Nurma

texts.en:
Nurma is a 47-year-old woman, married to Muhammad, a 48-year-old man. Nurma runs a business making Nasi Kuning (yellow rice packaged with side dishes such as fried chicken, omelet, fried noodle and ‘sambal’/ chili sauce) and her husband is also an entrepreneur. They are blessed with 4 children, namely; Bahrun, 17, just graduated the Senior High School; Nadia, 14, just graduated the Junior High School; Junaidi, 12 and Faisal, 9, both of whom are elementary school students. 

Nurma sells Nasi Kuning in her food stall not so far from her house. She operates the business every day from 6 am to 10 am. The business has been running for a year and she has got many customers. The income from its business is utilized to support her husband in meeting their family needs. Presently, Nurma needs more capital to buy more ingredients and spices therefore she is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to purchase extra rice, eggs, and spices.

loans.use: to purchase extra rice, eggs, and spices.

loans.name: Marigrace

texts.en:
Marigrace is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan also helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marigrace dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ronald Wilfredo

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco y cada día trabaja con mucho empeño como estibador, en una empresa de venta de conservas de su ciudad, Ronald trabaja en este empleo desde hace 3 años y es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Ronald esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado podrá comprar algunos muebles para su vivienda, ya que actualmente solo tiene unas sillas que ya se encuentran oxidadas, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terne una mejor calidad de vida y poder tener una vida digna”.
texts.en:
Ronald, 35 years old, lives in the city of Pisco and every day works with much determination as a stevedore, in a business that sells canned food in his city. Ronald has worked in this job for 3 years and it is his only source of income in order to be able to get ahead.

Ronald is grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help they offer, he will be able to purchase furniture for his home because he currently only has some chairs that are already rusted. In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue fighting to be able to realize his great dream: To have a better quality of life and to be able to have a dignified life.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Mila Rose

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mila Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Mila Rose is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy more gallons of gasoline to offer for resale.

Mila Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline to offer for resale.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clemencia is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Clemencia's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business and is committed to regain what she lost. Clemencia is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Clemencia has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit of her goal to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Clemencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dahlia

texts.en:
Dahlia is 37 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Dahlia works very hard to provide for them.

Dahlia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dahlia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Dahlia has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Dahlia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending and a tailoring businesses. Milagros is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of decorations, plastic-wares and other dry goods.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of decorations, plastic-wares and other dry goods.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Delia's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Delia is taking out a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Delia has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of her goal to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and as she has been with NWTF since 2013 she is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Dionisia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Dionisia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 56 years old and married with four children. Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dolores has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Dolores has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Dolores is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Edin

texts.en:
Edin is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edin is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Edin's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business buying and selling dried fish and is committed to regain what she lost. Edin is taking out a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Edin has been with NWTF since 2007 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Edin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Silvia Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca donde su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.
La Señora. Silvia tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y aun no ha concebido hijos, su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Silvia se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, estas actividades le han permitido pasar en su casa y aportar a la economía de su hogar, esto le ha ayudado también ser una mujer independiente económicamente. 
El dinero de su crédito va a comprar ganado de mejor calidad. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad, compañerismo, unión y apoyo que tienen todas sus integrantes, quienes están luchando para salir en adelante.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in the Cumbe parish in Cuenca, where the people work in agriculture and cattle raising. Much of the population has migrated to various places in the world, looking for a better quality of life for their families.

Silvia is 29 years old, she is married and has not yet conceived any children. Her husband works as a day laborer, and the house they live in is their own.

Silvia works raising animals and in agriculture. These jobs permit her to to spend time at home and support the household economy, this has also helped her be an economically independent woman.

The money from the loan will purchase better quality cattle. Her credit group likes it for its solidarity, camaraderie, bond and support that all the members have, who are all fighting to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ellen Anneli

texts.es:
Ellen tiene 30 años, vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja con mucho empeño como secretaria en una provincia del país en una institución, desde hace 11 años y de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Ellen esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar algunas mejoras en la vivienda de sus padres, especialmente en la habitación en la cual vive, como mejorar las paredes, entre otros y solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguira trabajando y esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Obtener su titulo profesional”.
texts.en:
Ellen is 30 years old, she lives in the district of Tinguiña, and every day makes a great effort to be able to get ahead. For this reason she has worked with much determination as a secretary in an institution in a province of the country for the past 11 years and, in this way, can have income to be able to get ahead.

Ellen is grateful for the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help that they are offering her, she will be able to make some improvement on her parents' house, especially in the room where she lives, such as improving the walls, among other repairs, and to pay some personal expenses.  In this way, she will be able to improve her quality of life and continue exerting herself to be able to realize her great dream: to get a professional degree.

loans.use: to improve the house.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela tiene 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa y trabaja en un empresa de su ciudad como empleada, es madre de 2 hijos a queines quiere mucho y por lo cual se esfuerza mucho por cumplir sus labores en su trabajo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante.
